title: Product Designer (Contract, $110-190/hr)
description: A¬∑Team is a VC-backed, stealth, application-only platform for senior product designers to team up with the best companies on their next big thing. After talking with hundreds of independent engineers, designers, and product folks, we heard over and over that finding vetted, high-quality, consistent clients is hard, and projects are often too small to be rewarding. A¬∑Team matches small teams of the most talented builders in the world with companies backed by a16z, YC, Softbank, General Catalyst, etc. on a contract basis for many of their most important initiatives. We quietly launched in May 2020, and have helped A¬∑Teamers earn $7.3+ million since.As part of A¬∑Team, you can expect: High-paying, meaningful missions with the most audacious companies sent your way; generally $110-$190/hr, with vetted, fascinating clients doing work that matters. A¬∑Team is picky, and only works with companies referred to us by top funds or existing members and clients such as Lyft, McGraw Hill, the former-CEO of Waze, a few new unicorns, and dozens of venture-backed startups by a16z, YC, Softbank, GC, etc. Keep 100% of what you make: we exist to empower independent builders, which is why A.Team charges a percentage on top of your standard rate. Do more with a team you like: our focus is on small, diverse, cross-functional teams of insanely talented developers, PMs, designers, growth leads, etc. This is because clients with bigger budgets & more ambitious work need teams to solve problems, not individuals to do tasks. That said, we try to keep friends together, since clients love builders who have worked together before. Full autonomy: we only want you to join teams when the timings right. Often they start around 15-20hrs/week, and last at least 3-6 months (longer if its going great, or contract-to-hire if true love is found). Small, curated, off-the-record gatherings: for conversations you wouldnt have elsewhere & connecting with other top-tier builders who you may like to collaborate with. How to apply:Go here: https://build.a.team/dribbble + mention Dribbble under how did you hear about A¬∑Team? No resume or cover letter needed; we respect your time so the application is short. Were super interested in seeing what youve made, so drop in a link to your Dribbble profile. Excited to chat more real soon if there‚Äôs a fit.What you‚Äôll do: Once part of A.Team, you‚Äôll regularly be invited to impactful missions that match your interests, which you can accept or decline. Take your pick from early-stage incubations with world-class founders, to fast-growing super-funded companies, to old school non-tech incumbents looking to build as a tech giant would Missions usually involve building an ambitious piece of software from 0 to 1 as part of a small 3-4 person team. You‚Äôll be paid to scope it out, give the client options, guide strategy, and execute on the selected solution. Sometimes the client has a clear vision, sometimes not; which is why A.Team builders tend to be senior folks who can work together to find the right direction. Who A¬∑Team is for: Senior product designers who left large companies and high-growth startups to pursue their craft with autonomy. Those who prefer consistent contract work over a full-time role, who want to create a variety of new products alongside other top-tier builders. The majority of A.Teamers spend most of their time doing independent work, but a sizeable percentage are either employed full-time (but testing out client work), bootstrapping a side project, or looking for their next big thing Who A¬∑Team is not for: People looking for small gigs Folks looking to build simple wordpress/wix/squarespace-style websites Those still early in their careers and recent university/bootcamp grads (at least not yet) Our long-term vision:A¬∑Team is a new type of company for a new kind of independent software builder. We call them unhirables: people who traditional companies couldn‚Äôt hire full-time even if they wanted to, but who want to do their most meaningful work with their favorite people in small, autonomous, distributed expert teams. To help us secure amazing missions, we raised $5 million+ (not public, yet) from NFX, Village Global, and Box Group, along with the former CEO of Upwork, the founders of Fiverr and Lemonade, Apples Global Head of Recruiting, YC Partner Aaron Harris, Whartons Adam Grant, and Dukes Dan Ariely.

title: Sr. Product Designer (Remote)
description: About ApolloFounded in 2015, Apollo is a leading sales intelligence and engagement platform trusted by over 13,000 paying customers, from rapidly growing startups to the largest global enterprises.Our platform unifies a database of 200 million business contacts with advanced intelligence and engagement tools, to help over 500,000 sales, marketing, and recruiting professionals to connect with the right person at the right time with the right message, at speed and scale.In the last year, we‚Äôve grown ARR 3x, quadrupled our active users, maintained profitability 18 out of the past 20 months, and recently closed a $110M Series C led by Sequoia to fuel the next phase of our growth.Working at ApolloWe are a remote-first inclusive organization focused on operational excellence. Our way of working ensures clear expectations and an environment to do your best work with ample reward. As a product-led organization, design & user experience are at the forefront of every decision that we make.Your Role & MissionWe are hiring a Senior Product Designer to help craft the future of Apollo. Product Designers serve a vital role here in helping us learn, test, and iterate to build the best experiences possible for our users. We appreciate designers who think deeply, speak clearly, love collaboration and feedback, and are always learning about best practices to master their craft!Our Product Managers, Design, and Engineering teams are structured as Squads that are focused on several core features of the product. You will be assigned to a Squad alongside one Product Manager and multiple Engineers. You will also regularly collaborate with designers from other pods to share learnings and ensure a cohesive user experience.Daily Adventures & Responsibilities Working with the Product Manager on your squad to help brainstorm, build & validate solutions to user problems & goals. Working with Engineers on your squad to understand constraints, hand off designs, and run design QA. Collaborating with your squad during Weekly Sprint Plannings & Daily Standups to ensure that we are building the best experience. Collaborating with other Designers to provide feedback, share + learn best practices & maintain a cohesive experience in the product. Interviewing users to validate designs & learn about user problems. Using & building upon our design system to update portions of your surface. Collaborating with your squad to identify the highest impact areas to work on, develop hypothesis, test, and iterate. Consistently integrating quantitative and qualitative data into essential product decisions. Skills & Competencies 4+ years of experience designing and shipping complex web-based products founded in data and customer insights. You have expert design instincts & best practice knowledge to translate user problems, user goals, business objectives and technical constraints into excellent product experiences to deliver quick turnarounds & shorten feedback loops. You‚Äôre a self-starter that thrives while working in a fast-paced environment, working on multiple projects simultaneously. You have experience creating and maintaining components across multiple product surfaces in Figma. You are a voracious learner, constantly trying to learn how to improve customer experience, drive core metrics. Continuously learns new industry standards, staying up to date with how to get the most out of modern design tools including Figma. You have a passion for typography and copywriting and know how to write a simple, compelling microcopy to support your UI design. You‚Äôre experimentation-oriented ‚Äì You have the ability to conduct user interviews, analyze the results of interviews, form hypothesis, test hypothesis with users via prototypes or product experimentation, and iterate. No big ego ‚Äì we can uphold excellent rhythms within our Product Management, Engineering & Design squads because each member has respect for each other, and has a shared understanding of the goals, vision, and principles that Apollo operates on. You‚Äôre highly interested in user-centric design ‚Äì we like to push each other to stay at the cutting edge of our field :) What Youll Love About ApolloWe offer a competitive salary and benefits, informal, fun, and remote working environment. Our culture thrives in openness and excellence, and we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees‚Äô careers.The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale.Our work environment is diverse with a global remote team, and we are intentional in building an inclusive culture where everyone can be the best version of themselves. We‚Äôre also very collaborative at Apollo, so you‚Äôll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You‚Äôll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you‚Äôll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!What Else? üìö A monthly budget for learning and development. üèù Unlimited PTO üçπ Team events

title: Graphic Designer
description: Company OverviewBlue Tees Golf is a leading golf equipment manufacturer and retailer, dedicated to providing high-quality products and exceptional customer service. With a commitment to innovation and excellence, Blue Tees Golf has become a trusted name in the industry, serving golfers of all skill levels.Job SummaryBlue Tees Golf is looking for a Product Focused Graphic Designer to join our growing company. The ideal candidate will be creative and innovative to come up with unique and practical designs that will attract consumers. They should also have a strong familiarity with visually appealing color schemes and design aesthetics. Effective research skills are required to successfully research our target market and identify common customer trends.Great communication skills are important as they will interact with other employees on the design and product development teams to effectively explain certain product specifications.This position is 100% remote, full-time, and offers competitive wages and paid benefits. Duties Work with the CCO on product designs, brand direction, manuals, packaging, etc. Create designs from scratch using the guidance provided by the CCO Skills / Requirements Adobe Creative Suite, with a strong proficiency in Photoshop, In Design, Adobe XD, and After Effects Innovative Experience with small electric or stand-alone electric devices is a plus Able to create custom design concepts and assets from scratch Strong organizational skills and ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines Good spatial and visual awareness Knowledge of industrial processes and standards, as well as emerging new golf technology The ability to clearly communicate the reasoning behind design choices. Ability to work U.S. west coast hours (PT, MT) Understand the basics of golf A compelling portfolio with projects showcasing skills in product design. Education & Experience A degree in Graphic Design or Product Design is a plus. 2-5+ years of graphic design and/or product design experience Experience in product design, packaging design, manuals, etc. BenefitsCompetitive salary and bonuses Medical, dental & vision coverage 401k with Match 100% remote Paid time off, including holidays and sick leave

title: Web Designer
description: Turbo.net is helping organizations worldwide multiply employee productivity with intelligent digital workspaces. As a pioneering force in application delivery technology, Turbo.net has long been an innovator in seamless, cross-platform software delivery. But its not just our technology that sets us apart; its our commitment to providing intuitive, engaging digital employee experiences. And this is where you come in.We are seeking a visionary Web Designer who will elevate our online presence. You will be the creative force behind our homepage, product pages, and marketing materials, creating designs that stir a deep connection with our users, inspire trust, and effectively communicate the innovative nature of our offerings.Key Responsibilities Design and implement beautiful and engaging home pages, product pages, and marketing pages that highlight our technologys unique features and benefits. Develop a deep understanding of our product to create designs that communicate its value and functionality effectively. Collaborate closely with our development and marketing teams to ensure our website is aligned with our brand guidelines and communicates our brand story powerfully and consistently. Create design prototypes and UI elements, using your expert knowledge of design software. Ensure our website design is responsive and accessible across multiple platforms and devices. Participate in user and conversion testing to receive feedback, and make necessary adjustments to optimize effectiveness. Requirements Strong creative and visual design skills, with a portfolio demonstrating your ability to create engaging web designs, preferably including technical products. Ability to understand Turbo and end user computing concepts, and translate these concepts into visually appealing and understandable marketing materials. Proficiency in design software like Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop), Figma, InVision, Webflow, and other relevant tools. Ability to incorporate animated elements (Lotie, Rive or similar) preferred. Understanding of web design principles, including layout, typography, and color theory. Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for rapid prototyping. Experience in responsive and mobile design. Ability to understand and translate technical products into visually compelling designs. Exceptional communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders Bachelors degree in a relevant field, or equivalent experience, is preferred This position may be based at our Redmond, Washington office or remote. We operate in a hybrid home/office work environment.

title: Art Director/Designer
description: Culture ONE World is a cross-cultural advertising agency that specializes in using creativity to drive social change that positively impacts communities. We are seeking an Art Director with a great imagination and dreams about changing the world with creativity and ideas. Experience in the multicultural youth-focused Latino and Black market, including work in Spanish and English, campaigns for LGBTQ+, and other diverse audiences, are a major plus. Concept development together with Creative Directors and seeing your vision all the way through visual/design execution is critical. The Art Director is also expected to bring new ideas and designs to produce bold, strategic, and persuasive products in all media for our clients.You need to know how to:‚óè Speak, read, write, and breath the young cross cultural urban experience‚óè Concept creative campaigns across a broad range of media, in a variety of tones and voices‚óè Do high-level brand concepting and ideation‚óè Daily execution on client deliverables including graphic designs, layouts, data visualizations, and PPT deck designs‚óè Work productively as a teammate with creative directors, copywriters, and producers who share responsibility on client assignments‚óè Design and animation of social content and social assets across all channels‚óè Collaborate with account leadership to understand client goals, strategy and feedback aligned to creative briefs‚óè Present concepts to other departments if necessary and revise concepts according to comments.‚óè Have internal and external communication and presentation skills, present and defend the work clearly and confidently‚óè Work with social media platforms and have a working knowledge of their best practices. ‚óè Have a positive attitude, and respect for others. We are looking for doers ‚Äì people who lean in, check their egos at the door, and have a real willingness to collaborate with other members of the teamYou have. . .‚óè Strong multi-platform portfolio showcasing a wide range of work (print, digital banners, social, motion, OOH, etc.) concepted and executed by you‚óè Formal design training and 5+ years of design experience in a creative agency, preferably an ad agency‚óè Proven multitasking skills managing multiple projects/tasks/teams of varying complexities, meeting deadlines, and working well under pressure‚óè An expert understanding of Photoshop, Illustrator, and Figma‚óè Expertise in motion graphics is a major plus‚óè An up-to-date awareness of modern culture, design standards, technology, and trendsCompensation, benefits, and time off are commensurate with your experience.

title: Lead Product Designer
description: TL;DR: Were building a new sleep product & looking for a strong lead product designer to join the team. This is a multidisciplinary role that includes research, interaction design, prototyping, and visual design while working closely with the founder/CEO, Head of Product and engineering team.About us:Simple Habit, a mental wellness & meditation platform, was created in 2017 by CEO/Founder Yunha Kim. Our mission? To help people live better. In just a couple of years, Simple Habit grew mostly organically to $5M in ARR. Shortly after, we raised $10M in a Series A round. In 2020, based on insights & learnings, Simple Habit decided to build & launch a new product, Sleep Reset. Our mission has stayed the same; to help people live better....but our focus has shifted to solving our users #1 wellness problem, sleep!Sleep Reset is a first of its kind wellness program. We applied proven and effective methods from the Stanford Sleep Clinic and digitized them into one seamless sleep program. These methods are currently administered in person, but we believe and have proven that we can achieve the same outcome, digitally.See our product launch featured in TechCrunch, Yahoo News, & MarketWatch!Location: Were a fully distributed team of 9 FTEs & 14 contractors, working remotely from both EST & PST time zones. The Product Team & Process:‚Ä¢ We are a remote, nimble and fast-moving team of one product manager and a content writer.‚Ä¢ We all have different and unique backgrounds and share a passion about helping people sleep better. ‚Ä¢ We all operate as owners to drive our initiatives from design to implementation. We work directly with the engineering team to see our vision come to life. ‚Ä¢ We are analytical and prefer to use data to build confidence in our decisions. We always keep our users first and do what is best for them to get the best outcomes we can. ‚Ä¢ We hire passionate people who are self starters. We provide structure, but also give lots of room for you to explore and find opportunities within our product. The Role:In this role, you will become an expert in our users and their needs through data and research. You will be able to construct big picture customer journeys as well as create designs for specific features.Youll thrive in this role if youre:‚Ä¢ Interested in an immense amount of responsibility & ownership at an early-stage startup‚Ä¢ Highly entrepreneurial and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with minimal guidance‚Ä¢ Someone with an extreme growth mindset, driven by intense curiosity. We believe there is always room for us to improve as individual developers, a team, and a company.‚Ä¢ Excited that no day is like the other‚Ä¢ Nimble & passionate. We believe in ownership and expect all team members to bring technical, growth, and product ideas to the table. Desired Qualifications: You have 5+ years of UX/UI design experience. You have experience working at a consumer start up. You have experience with working with Lottie and other animation formats. You have designed and shipped features from scratch. You have experience writing technical design documents and collaborating with a team of engineers. You can Incorporate user insights and validate decisions through rapid prototyping and testing. You have a design portfolio that demonstrates outstanding interaction design skills from architecture, flow mapping, to prototyping. *Bonus Points* Passion for data and metrics Strong product mindset Experience with direct to consumer health tech products. Personal experience/connection with sleep issues Why you might be excited about joining us: We‚Äôre tackling a big and common problem, sleep. Were solving it with a solution that has never been done before. Current participants in our program rave about Sleep Reset. Over 80% of our users improve their sleep by week 4. You‚Äôll be able to work remotely and (mostly) set your own schedule. Weve been remote for over two years and have the whole how to work well remotely thing down. Youll have endless flexibility in your role and will be part of defining our culture, operations, infrastructure and how we do things at Simple Habit. Everyone on the team is extremely mission-driven and works incredibly hard to push towards our lofty ambitions. Although Sleep Reset is new, Simple Habit is not -- this comes with many benefits. (Popular opinion) Our team is incredible. Full stop. Weve retained over 90% of our team through a pandemic and a product pivot! We take our culture very seriously & aim to maintain (and continue to elevate) our close-knit and supportive bond. We came for the mission, but we stay for each other. Simple Habit Creed:There will be no failures, only learning experiences.There will be no task below us, only opportunities to help.We are here because we share a common sense of purpose.We are here to help people live better, every day.We are all owners.All colors, all ages, all races and religions.We all took risks to be here.Our passion is people,Not ping pong tables.We get in the zone.We take boba breaks.We believe in self-care.We believe in feedback.We dont waffle.We will disagree and commit.We will continuously improve.For the curious and the bold,Humble and confident.This company, and world, is ours to make better.

description: I have an existing app, built in flutter for android and ios. I need to improve the user experience. Its like a student management app; I will provide you with the functions of every user and you check the app and provide the design.

title: Principal Product Designer (all genders)
description: We are currently looking for a Principal/Staff Product Designer to join our mission at TradeLink. You will assist in establishing standards for approaching and resolving design challenges and taking an active role in shaping our product to be the solution of choice for frictionless supply chain collaboration.YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES: UX Design & Research:: Owning end2end Product Research/DesigUX in one domain with our teams. Collaboration: Contributing to cross team topics like Design System and Research Repository. Visual Design: Utilize your graphic design expertise to create visually stunning interfaces that enhance user interaction and satisfaction. Data-Driven Decisions: Perform rigorous testing and validation of design concepts, leveraging data to optimize design decisions and measure success. Design Excellence: Advocate for design excellence and continuous improvement, pushing the boundaries of whats possible in design. Team: Mentoring Junior Product Designers WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED: Design Mastery: Extensive experience as a Product Designer or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing your UX research, design skills, and visual design prowess in B2B/Software products or similar. User-Centric Approach: A deep understanding of user-centered design principles and UX research methodologies, with a track record of creating intuitive, user-friendly interfaces. Technical Skills: Proficiency in design software (e.g., Figma, Miro, Dovetail) and familiarity with HTML/CSS. Communication Excellence: Outstanding communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate and defend design decisions and concepts effectively. Teamwork & Leadership: Proven ability to work collaboratively and lead design initiatives within cross-functional teams, with a strong individual contributor mindset. Experience in coaching and mentoring other designers is a plus. Growth Mindset: A robust growth mindset, demonstrating resilience and the drive to tackle challenges head-on, continuously learn and grow. Language Skills: Fluency in English and German WHATS IN IT FOR YOU: Being part of an exceptionally fast-growing product-led venture thats up to something big. We are building a new type of company, a SaaS-enabled B2B network Working with the newest tools and methods alongside enthusiastic, motivated people willing to make a difference. A diverse and international team of experts as well as experienced founders Autonomy, flexible working hours, and a remote-first setup (optional offices in Munich and Berlin), which connects our team members across Europe Lots of support and learning opportunities - your growth and personal development are our priority With regular team events, we encourage our teams to connect within and outside of work for a great spirit A phenomenal company culture, both remote and in our optional offices If you arent completely confident that you meet our criteria, we recommend to just taking the chance and applying anyway! Curiosity, passion for digital disruption, eagerness to learn, a collaborative spirit, and a growth mindset are most important to us.TradeLink strongly believes in the power of diversity and is highly committed to providing a respectful, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone who works here or with us.

title: Principal Product Designer
description: Modular Cloud is building the next-gen version of a product known as a ‚Äúblock explorer‚Äù. Blockchain data is typically hard to access and understand. Block explorers solve this problem by presenting the data on the web in a human-readable format.From a design perspective, our block explorer is different from others in the following ways: It is a power tool for developers. Think about how Superhuman revolutionized the UX of email. Or how Linear made mundane product management delightful. We want to create a similarly elevated experience for developers accessing blockchain data‚Äîallowing them to efficiently access what they need in the most enjoyable way possible. Our technology platform is customizable. There is no one-size-fits all. There are thousands blockchain protocols and smart contracts in existence. How can we craft a universal UI perfectly suited to each of these use cases? We can‚Äôt. Therefore, we are building programmability and customizability into our application. Everything is open source. Our designs and code will all be open to the public. While the company does maintain some proprietary IP, the block explorer is completely open. People can look at the designs, read the code, learn from it, use it, and run it locally. We want to give back to the community. This role is for the main designer at the company. As a result, these will be the responsibilities: Design strategy. How should we approach design given the company‚Äôs objectives? Creativity. This is a creative role. We deeply value this capacity. UI and UX. We need someone who can create beautiful, functional designs based on the needs of our users. This includes things like animated page transitions, custom icons, and building a design system. Wear many hats. Since this role is for our main designer, this person will also need to be able to help with designing landing pages, creating marketing assets, and managing design contractors. Branding. Although we will likely engage an outside agency for branding, we need our in-house designer to be a part of this process. Work closely with the founders. Modular Cloud is a small company that raised $1.7M in venture capital. This role will report directly to the CEO (who is also the frontend developer). Qualifications Evidence of exceptional ability (portfolio or work experience) No blockchain familiarity needed Thinks working hard is a good thing

title: Graphic Designer (Data Visualization)
description: Earthjustice is the premier nonprofit environmental law organization. We take on the biggest, most precedent-setting cases across the country. We wield the power of law and the strength of partnership to protect people‚Äôs health; to preserve magnificent places and wildlife; to advance clean energy; and to combat climate change. We partner with thousands of groups, supporters, individuals and communities to engage the critical environmental issues of our time, and bring about positive change. We are here because the earth needs a good lawyer.Founded in 1971, Earthjustice has a distinguished track record of achieving significant, lasting environmental protections. We achieve this by hiring people who share a passion for justice and a healthy environment. Our headquarters are in San Francisco with offices in Anchorage, Juneau, Los Angeles, Miami, Tallahassee, Honolulu, Houston, New York, Philadelphia, Chicago, Denver, Seattle, Bozeman, and Washington, DC.This position will produce high-quality print and digital designs and infographics that reflect Earthjustice‚Äôs established brand standards, while advancing the evolution of our brand identity. As an integral member of the Creative Team, the Graphic Designer / Data Visualization will work closely with other members of Communications, Development and program staff on design projects that support both fundraising and marketing efforts, as well as high-impact programmatic work.Candidates willing to work from San Francisco under a hybrid model are preferred, but we will consider candidates interested in working remotely within the U.S.ResponsibilitiesGraphic Design (55%) Serve as an in-house designer on a variety of institutional print collateral, including brochures, calendars, magazines, and reports. Design materials for marketing and fundraising events, including event banners, invitations, giveaways, and promotional materials. Actively participate in Creative team sessions on storytelling, campaign brainstorms, and strategic planning. Work with Development and Communications staff to create high-value pitch decks for major funders. Organize and archive images on digital asset management system. Monitor brand consistency across all creative and graphic materials. Maintain existing brand standards and further develop organizational brand identity. Knowledge of printing techniques and ability to handle prepress file preparation. Conceptualize and coordinate unified materials within context of a larger campaign. Meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Data Visualization (45%) Create and edit visual content including infographics, charts, and maps. Use critical thinking and communication skills to convert raw facts and numbers into usable graphics that further our programmatic goals Transform sets of data into compelling visuals that advance our narratives. Provide guidance on data visualization to wider Communications team. Create assets for digital platforms (website, social media, email, etc.), such as infographics, charts, image macros, animated gifs, and PowerPoint decks. Qualifications BA in Visual Arts, Graphic Design, Digital Media Design, or equivalent combination of training and design experience required. Minimum of 4 years of professional experience in the field of graphic design. A minimum of 3 years of experience in data visualization, ideally 4-5 years. Advanced proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator) and Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word and Excel). Thorough knowledge of visual design principles, including photography, typography, iconography, color theory. Ability to work with scientific and/or legal data and distill the ‚Äòbig picture‚Äô. Expertise with chart-making and other data visualization techniques. Comfort with analyzing data sets to find the best visual solution. Ability to multitask while being extremely organized, productive, timely and reliable. Ability to synthesize constructive feedback into responsive designs while still maintaining strong, cohesive vision. Ability to work independently on projects from initial stages to completion and take direction well while showing initiative. Cultural sensitivity and awareness, especially in image selection. Ability to work cross-functionally and on teams; possesses strong communication skills. Freehand illustration skills are a plus. Knowledge of social media is a plus. Cartography skills are a plus. Experience with data-based journalism and tools is a plus. Experience creating high-value pitch decks for major funders is a big plus. Knowledge of environmental issues preferred. Demonstrates an awareness and sensitivity to the needs and concerns of individuals from diverse cultures, backgrounds and orientations. Contributes to the creation of a diverse, equitable and inclusive work culture that encourages and celebrates differences. Salary and BenefitsWe offer a competitive salary and excellent benefits that are comprehensive and competitive. We also offer an extremely congenial work environment and a casual dress code. As a 501(c)(3) organization, Earthjustice is a qualifying employer for purposes of the Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) Program.Salary is based on experience and location.Salary range in San Francisco, CA or New York, NY: $81,000 - $90,000 Salary range in Seattle, Washington, D.C. or Chicago: $77,000-$85,500 Salary range in Denver, Philadelphia, or Juneau: $72,900-$81,000 Salary range in Miami, Texas (State), Atlanta: $68,900-$76,500Remote salary range for other locations in the U.S.: $68,900 - $90,000To Apply:Interested candidates should submit the following via Jobvite by June 23rd: Resume Cover letter describing their interest in this position and how their skills align with the described duties and essential skills and abilities Portfolio that includes both graphic design projects and data visualization projects (1-2 portfolio links preferred or attachment included in application materials). Earthjustice is driven by a passion for justice, partnership and excellence. Our core values lead us to seek a broad range of perspectives and backgrounds to achieve our mission and to maintain an inclusive environment where all staff are valued and respected. As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to employment practices that ensure that employees and applicants for employment are given equal opportunities without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information or any other factor that is not related to the position.For positions located within the City and County of San Francisco: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.For positions located within the City of Los Angeles: We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring.

title: Senior Designer - Conservative YouTuber
description: Looking for an awesome designer for full time work with a famous conservative influencer/creator. This designer must have a wide range of artistic abilities to create themes for e-learning video courses.Compensation: $85K + full healthWe need a hard worker who is quick, passionate about amazing design, a great communicator, and takes constructive notes well.The work will be mostly creating static graphic styles, course titles and graphics, often using generative AI etc. Very rarely will you need to animate, but you must have an eye for animation. title: Senior Designer
description: Stacvalley, Germanys leading marketing agency for Amazon sellers, is on the lookout for a talented and experienced Senior Designer to join our dynamic and creative team. While our headquarters are in Germany, this specific role is open to candidates interested in working remotely.As a Senior Designer at Stacvalley, youll be responsible for designing and creating high-quality product images. Your creative abilities will play a pivotal role in narrating the story of each product and enticing buyers to press the purchase button.Responsibilities: Designing and creating appealing product images that highlight the USPs and foster buyer engagement. Collaborating with the marketing and product team to bolster the visual communication and brand identity of our clients on Amazon. Continuously updating and adapting to the latest design trends and best practices in the e-commerce industry. Adhering to project timelines and ensuring compliance with quality standards across all design projects. Qualifications: A minimum of three years of experience in a similar role, ideally in an agency specializing in Amazon or other e-commerce platforms. An impressive portfolio that showcases your ability to develop and implement creative concepts. Expert knowledge in common design software tools such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, etc. Strong organizational skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Excellent communication skills and the ability to accept and implement constructive feedback. If youre passionate about delivering groundbreaking creative work and want to write the next chapter of your career in one of Germanys most successful agencies, we look forward to your application. Your creative abilities have the potential to create a ripple in the Amazon marketplace, and we cant wait to achieve that with you.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Who we are:Axion‚Äôs mission is to create the world‚Äôs best automotive and aerospace engineering management analytics platform, powered by machine learning. We‚Äôre revolutionizing the way next-gen vehicles are made and have partnered with forward-looking engineering leaders to deploy machine learning models that will accelerate our speed to an electric, connected, supersonic future. Our team includes experts in Machine Learning, Enterprise AI, and SaaS from GoogleX, Spotify, Microsoft, Palantir, McKinsey & QuantumBlack, and other top tech companies. Since our founding at the onset of 2021, we‚Äôve deployed across some of the largest Automotive and Aerospace companies in the world. If you want the chance to help build the future of engineering leadership, join us.Why Us:Join a fast-growing, early-stage startup with the chance to make a significant impact from day one. Our culture puts people first. We will encourage you to bring your full self to work and will set you up to succeed.You‚Äôll also get: Highly competitive compensation Meaningful equity Leadership opportunity in a high-growth company A great team. We bring a unique combination of technical and business skills, with company leaders from top tech companies like Spotify, business leadership from McKinsey, and automotive leadership from GM and Ford. We‚Äôre an interdisciplinary team that prizes collaboration & diversity of thinking. Where you‚Äôll be:Prefer an office to work? We have options for your working preferences. Prefer to work from home? You can Work From Anywhere at Axion.We are looking for a Product Designer who will: Strategise, sketch and design new products and features for a diverse set of users Translate user requirements and your own research into tangible design concepts to bring a product concept to life quickly Help run short design sprints and work in a fast-moving, agile environment Be able to conduct your own user research as well as building and testing prototypes Feel equally comfortable sketching and wireframing a design solution as you are making UI and data visualisations look beautiful and compelling Ideally help build out a design system and help develop patterns and components for re-use with our engineering teams Your expertise: 5 years‚Äô experience designing user-centred products and enterprise applications, ideally with experience visualising data An awe-inspiring portfolio and a design process that you can articulate clearly Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain the rationale behind your design concepts Experience with agile methodologies and integrating design with cross-functional delivery teams An obsessive attention-to-detail in everything you do, from storytelling and clarity of communication through to detailed wireframes and UI designs Experience working with data science teams in an enterprise environment would be a huge advantage. Knowledge and experience using tools such as Figma and Adobe Creative Suite Come work with us, were growing!

title: Product Marketing Designer, Freelance
description: Caraway is an NYC-based digital healthcare company for Gen Z providing mental, physical & reproductive healthcare services, all in one place. Our experienced Care Team delivers integrated, evidence-based care tailored to 18-29 year olds, available 24/7 through our mobile app. Our vision is big: were both treating our members needs in-the-moment, and providing them with the skills to manage their health over their lifetime. Our care platform is also centered around women and people assigned female at birth, recognizing that focusing on overlooked populations ultimately allows us to provide better care for everyone. If you want to be part of a mission-driven, motivated, collaborative team working to change healthcare for a generation, come join us!‚ÄçOur team is seeking a part-time designer to support our growth and marketing efforts for approximately 8-12 weeks. Under the direction of the Head of Brand Experience, this role will work closely with our Content, Engagement, and Product teams to develop marketing assets ‚Äì including custom landing pages, decks, and marketing collateral ‚Äì to support our member acquisition campaigns. We‚Äôre looking for a designer with an understanding of WebFlow, HTML and CSS, as well as a strong visual sensibility and understanding of core UX principles. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working independently, iteratively, and quickly to make an impact.‚ÄçPlease provide your portfolio when applying. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered. What youll do Design and develop custom landing pages as part of our WebFlow website to drive new member sign-up as part of our acquisition campaigns, including podcast and newsletter ads. Partner with our Content lead to develop a suite of new email marketing and Instagram post templates. Design physical collateral (e.g. pamphlets, one-pagers) to be used with B2B partners, including student health centers and insurance providers to highlight Caraway‚Äôs services. Design additional collateral to be used by student ambassadors as part of campus events, including SWAG, flyers, and banners. Who you are You have at least 3-5+ years prior UI/UX product design experience working on consumer products, mobile apps, or at design-focused companies You have Knowledge of front end/mobile development languages, including experience working with HTML, CSS, and designing for software similar to WebFlow You have strong visual and graphic design skills, with layout experience for both print and web Experience with creative software including Canva, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), UXPin You have a deep understanding and proven experience with digital design for consumers, with a focus on web and mobile products You have strong knowledge of modern UI/UX and product design standards, as well as mobile/responsive techniques for web design You appreciate brand design and are comfortable both integrating with and evolving a brand‚Äôs visual identity to meet audience needs You‚Äôre a team player with low ego and a willingness to be curious and collaborative You‚Äôre mission-aligned, and excited to work on something that impacts the health of Gen Z, and focuses on women and AFAB people of all races, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations Bonus points for experience with direct to consumer solutions in women‚Äôs health care or other services for the Gen Z market, as well as experience working in growth stage business Comfort with simple coding, data tagging, animation skills, media editing, demo production also a plus Why youll love working hereCaraway offers the opportunity to be a part of a startup environment and work closely with the founding team and industry leading investors & advisors. Caraway offers the following benefits:‚Äç Competitive salary Mission-driven & team-oriented culture Hybrid & flexible working environment ‚ÄçCaraway is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and creating an inclusive work environment for all. All candidates are welcome to apply.

title: Graphic Designer
description: Please make sure to submit your professional portfolio in English while applying! üí∏ 26-34k EUR per year, full time contractor contractüá¨üáß ¬£23-30k salary on a full time, permanent contractüåé Edinburgh office or fully remote working from anywhere in Europe!‚ú® Exciting products, millions of users, sold to global brandsüíª Working with the latest hardware, tech stack and toolsüèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Access to benefits (country dependent üåé )ABOUT USFounded in 2008, we are an international team that works with incredible and globally-recognised clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry. Whether it‚Äôs developing our own products, producing engaging social content en-masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends. Currently, we are a growing team of 125+ people, but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and values as we do. If the idea of a fast-paced, dynamic role with tonnes of opportunity for change, responsibility and innovation sounds exciting to you, then read on!RESPONSIBILITIESWhat can you expect? Reviewing never-before-seen TV episodes before they‚Äôre released Using Figma and Adobe Creative Suite to produce high-quality social content for high profile US TV clients Using existing branding guidelines and source material to create fun social media assets to engage fans and promote US TV shows Suggesting a variety of creative solutions and providing options for managers and clients to consider Following client accounts and competitors on social media to research and put forward own ideas for engaging and innovative content Producing assets that convey a clear and effective message with impact and creative flair that encourage click through or engagement Managing time well to produce multiple assets per day and communicate with managers on progress Learning our collaborative tools and using them to drive your assets through our internal processes Self-evaluating, proofing and reviewing own work Incorporating internal and client feedback into final product Developing your own skills by learning from other team members and through independent research QUALIFICATIONSWhats important to us: Excellent eye for detail particularly in regards to typography and layout Advanced understanding of Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, especially Photoshop and Illustrator Experience and skills in illustratiodigital artwork Experience with producing fun, polished, well-designed assets Ability to work well under the pressure of deadlines while maintaining accuracy Ability to adjust well to feedback and changing priorities High work-ethic and self-motivation YOUR WORKING ENVIRONMENT Modern Tech StackWe use the latest tools, hardware and methodologies across our teams. We‚Äôre always on the look-out for new ways of working and ensure everyone is setup with enough hardware firepower to excel, Windows or Mac.Agility & Openness for IdeasWe actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you‚Äôre the specialist here! Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.Outstanding PeopleWe believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality and skills, we‚Äôre an international team with more than 125 people onboard and we‚Äôre looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!FlexibilityWe‚Äôre a remote-first company and support 100% remote working for this role. For this role, your working hours will be from 10am - 6pm (GMT+1). Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we‚Äôre physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.PAYMENTWithin Europe, 26-34k EUR per year (or local currency equivalent) full-time contractor contract, depending on experience and skills.Within the UK, ¬£23k-30k per year, depending on experience and skills.CONTRACT TYPEFull time contractor contract - fully remote working from anywhere in Europe! Permanent / Full time within the UKRECRUITMENT PROCESSFirstly, we will invite you to a first interview - Here you will meet Ciara, our Senior Manager of Content Production, in a 60 minute interview via Zoom. It‚Äôs a mix of technical and culture-fit questions as well as providing you with more details about our projects and working in our team. If the technical interview with Ciara goes well, we will invite you to complete a design task followed by the final interview (30 minutes) with Nina, our Head of Content Production ‚Äì it‚Äôs a mix of technical and culture-fit questions.And that‚Äôs it!

title: Senior Designer
description: Job: Resign Internal Tools + Build Upcoming Website DesignsLocation: Remote.Who we are: Were a record label based in Cluj, Romania. Website: 11x11.ioWhat we need:Recently, weve created a lot of tools and dashboards using PowerBi and Airtable. However, the designs are all over the place and we need someone to help us connect everything and make it look good.We need help with redesigning all of our dashboards and connecting them together. These dashboards are related to accounting, music production, contracts, artist royalties, catalogue management, and analytics. We want all of these dashboards to be password-protected and available on our website.We also need help with designing a music storage and sharing app, similar to Dropbox and SoundCloud. We want it to be easy to use and have all the features we need.Lastly, we need a website design that displays our original songs catalog, which will act as a marketplace for smaller independent filmmakers and TV advertising teams to find songs that fit a specific vibe or sound.

title: Product Designer
description: About The Role:At Montra, we‚Äôre working to create a magical video creation experience; in doing so, design is at the centre of who we are. As our first product design hire, youll work closely with our CEO to wireframe, design and ultimately shape the user experience and interface beyond our initial MVP. You‚Äôll have the autonomy to take risks and challenge the norms well beyond your typical video editor.What You‚Äôll Do: Work closely with our CEO to build upon our existing distinct product and brand guidelines Own the design process from start to finish, including wire-framing, prototyping, and developer walk-through Frequently iterate on designs based on internal and external feedback Simplify complex design problems into beautiful user experiences Who You Are:Must Have 2-5 yrs of UI/UX design experience Proficient in working collaboratively in Figma Obsessed with crafting simple and gorgeous user experiences A robust portfolio of past work/projects demonstrating your ascetic and abilities to simplify complex problems Excellent verbal and written communication skills Great To Have Deep interest in the future of video as a communication method and how we‚Äôll build products that shape that future Self-motivated person who can work individually and as part of a team Experience in working in remote and in person teams Ability to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic environment How to Apply:At Montra, we believe the best team members come from diverse backgrounds and bring unique experiences to work. We don‚Äôt care where you came from, where you went to school, or what you do. We simply care about your grit, work ethic, and passion for video as a mechanism for sharing ideas. While the makeup of our team is not all one and the same, we are all bonded by our belief that a world where more people can create videos they‚Äôre proud of is a world we all want to live in. If that sounds like a world you want to help create, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

title: Founding Product Designer (who can code)
description: Hybrid (Washington DC) About the companyAt Move AI, were tackling the chaos and stress of moving by creating a simplified, customer-centric product that makes the entire moving process seamless.Were developing a robust platform that handles every facet of relocation, from the initial planning to post-move recurring services. This isnt just about hiring a great mover or changing addresses. Its about building a comprehensive solution that answers to every possible worry, giving our customers the peace of mind they deserve during this transitional phase of their lives. Anything they made need in their life, we want to be there to connect them.Were leveraging advanced AI and automation to not only enhance the customer experience but revolutionize marketplace experience as a whole. The fragmented, non-transparent nature of this industry is now our competitive advantage.About the roleWere seeking a Founding Product Engineer at Move AI. This isnt a regular role - youll be critical to the development of our product, from user research to front-end execution. You will have a significant equity stake in the business. If you have experience in design and full-stack development, thats exactly what we need. Youll spend weeks in Figma and then weeks coding.About youYou want to work on a small team of people who are all builders. Were looking for someone who can communicate clearly and directly. You have the ability to identify the core issues. You should have substantial experience in product design and development, or enough to know where the usual potholes are. Youre adept at using Figma and making quick, informed decisions. You know how to create a front end website using a modern javascript framework.If this resonates with you, please apply here. Lets build something great.What youll own Perform user research to understand the moving process and our customers painpoints better. Work with the team to develop design an overall design strategy Create many creative concepts quickly in Figma Get feedback on those designs from the team Iterate on feedback. Making it real: Youll translate Figma to a front end html, css and javascript. Your ability to connect design to back-end/AI/ML is key. What youll do You‚Äôll be the design team (research, user experience, user interaction, visual design) Youll be the front end team What were seekingMust haves Proficiency in rapid prototyping and interface design tools such as Figma. Demonstrated ability to design user-centric products based on user research. Proven ability to identify and address root problems efficiently. Direct, straightforward communication style, able to convey complex concepts with clarity. Ability to work independently and make quick decisions based on your experience and judgement. A track record of shipping high-quality software products on time. Experience with agile development methodologies and a preference for a fast-paced, iterative design and development process. Familiarity with modern frontend frameworks and libraries (React, Vue, Angular). Nice to Haves Strong experience with full-stack development. We need you to be able to contribute across the entire tech stack Experience or interest in AI and machine learning, as our product heavily relies on these technologies. Prior work in a startup environment. Comfort with quick changes and a high degree of autonomy is beneficial. Knowledge or experience about the moving process. Certainly not a deal breaker if youve never moved in your life, but probably a red flag if youve lived in the same place your whole life. Back-end experience, particularly with cloud services and databases. Move AI is compliant with AI Employment Regulation

title: Senior Product Designer
description: SeatGeek believes live events are powerful experiences that unite humans. With our technological savvy and fan-first attitude we‚Äôre simplifying and modernizing the ticketing industry.Whether it‚Äôs celebrating your favorite team‚Äôs victory, dancing to your favorite DJ with thousands of new friends, or enjoying your favorite Broadway show, one thing is for certain: nothing beats live. SeatGeek is on a mission to transform the $300 billion ticketing industry. Ticketing is complex; the variety of end users and UX flows makes for challenging and fascinating design work. We‚Äôve created products for fans and venues that make ticketing easier, more modern, and more fun. We‚Äôve done a lot already, and we‚Äôre excited to grow our design team so we can keep innovating. Join us! Product design at SeatGeekWe‚Äôre a group of passionate, humble, and curious designers and researchers distributed across the globe. We pride ourselves on our attention to detail and culture of craftsmanship. We believe collaboration is the key to our success, and that great ideas can come from anyone, regardless of experience, title, or background. We value maker time, asynchronous communication, lifelong learning, and making space to gain the perspectives and experiences needed to create our best work and live our best lives.What you‚Äôll doYou‚Äôll work closely with a cross functional team of product managers, engineers, data analysts, and user researchers to advance user and business goals. Your work will focus on: Defining user-centered problem statements to bring clarity to what we‚Äôre trying to accomplish and why it‚Äôs important to fans. Conceptualizing and designing solutions that push forward user and business goals. Working with your research and product partners to uncover user problems and evaluate solutions. Producing high fidelity deliverables that obsess with implementation ease just as much as pixel-perfection Driving design quality forward with designs that instill trust with our users and deliver moments of delight Collaboratively improving our design systems to ensure consistency and high quality experiences across all our products. Who you are 10+ years of product design experience. You have a 4+ hours of overlap with a 9:30am-5:30pm workday (US East Coast). You‚Äôve been part of successful cross-functional and outcome-oriented teams. You have an eye for detail and a high-bar for design quality. You get just as excited about defining the problem as you do about exploring solutions. Value lifelong learning and are always looking for new ways to learn and grow. Perks Equity stake Flexible work environment, allowing you to work as many days a week in the office as you‚Äôd like or 100% remotely A WFH stipend to support your home office setup Flexible PTO Up to 16 weeks of paid family leave 401(k) matching program Health, vision, dental, and life insurance Annual subscriptions to Headspace, Ginger.io, and One Medical $120 a month to spend on tickets to live events Annual subscription to Spotify, Apple Music, or Amazon music

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Skydio is the leading US drone manufacturer and world leader in autonomous flight, the key technology for the future of drones and aerial transportation. The Skydio team combines deep expertise in artificial intelligence, best-in-class hardware and software product development, and operational excellence to empower a broader, more diverse audience of drone users - from action sports enthusiasts to first responders.About the role: As a Senior Product Designer you will research, prototype, design and ship web and mobile applications that unlock Skydio hardware‚Äôs potential across a wide array of inspection, industrial, construction, public safety and defense use cases. You will work directly with the Sr. Director of Product Design, Designers, Product Managers, and Engineers to understand our customers most pressing needs and build incredible cross-platform experiences:How youll make an impact: Design core and new functionality for Skydio Cloud. These include: Media Management Fleet Management Inspection & Mapping Data Visualization Annotation and Records Tools Remote Operation Go on-site with customers to deeply understand their needs, use cases and work with Product Managers and Engineers to build incredible new AI based tools that customers love Work with other designers, engineers and marketers to build out the Skydio Design Language across our Cloud, Mobile, and Marketing experiences. Discover, design and document new components, modules, visual styles and treatments that will create a toolbox for ALL designers to build more efficiently and cohesively Provide mockups, user flows, pixel-perfect designs in Figma, or write HTML/CSS directly to drive the design process for engineers, while communicating design goals to PMs and Executives Bring your insights and experience to improve production and processes around the design org What makes you a good fit: Proven track record of delivering effective design to consumer and/or enterprise customers A portfolio that clearly defines your contributions shipping cloud products in multiple disciplines within design including: Photo management Data or Fleet Management Geospatial Analysis or Mapping 3D Web Tools Video Review Workflows Remote Hardware Sensing (cameras, robotics, aviation) Solid understanding of design systems that span mobile, web and marketing Strong examples of beautiful data, visualization, 3d, and table layout and visual design Bonus Experience: Familiarity with 3D for Web (WebGL, Cesium, ThreeJS) Some front-end coding ability in HTML/CSS/Javascript Familiarity with Front-end design libraries like Ant, Bootstrap, Tailwind CSS. Familiarity with 3D Animation tools like Cinema4D, Blender, Maya and After Effects

title: Senior Product Designer
description: As a Senior Product Designer, you will have significant ownership of design objectives and strategy. This role will be responsible for discovering opportunities for product excellence and differentiation on our products. Combining an understanding of business opportunities with a deep empathy for the user, you‚Äôll work on creating experiences that help customers invest in alternatives to improve their overall wealth. You‚Äôll collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization to determine strategy, roadmaps and deliverables while also maintaining a lot of autonomy over your work.What youll do:Product Strategy Conceptualize and design for web (including mobile) and print Contribute at a high level for design strategy and communicate the vision, roadmap, and goals for a business Define short- and long-term design opportunities for the product. Collaborate closely with Product Management, Engineering, Analytics and Business Development to define product solutions as well as business efficiencies Partner with Product Managers to develop the strategy and rationale for product solutions Partner closely with Engineering to ensure our implementation and user experience is of high-quality Prioritize internal, cross-functional, and external design resource(s). Create and iterate on solutions that are inspired by a deep empathy for our users Identify key opportunities to meet and prioritize user and business needs Use research and data to inform and implement solutions Ideate new product features and improvements. Work collaboratively to prioritize feature ideas. Flesh out feature concepts. UX Design Develop strategic insights and strategies to guide UX development Create high level user flows for complex products. Design processes, features, and components that can be used Understand business and technical needs Works cross-functionally (in and outside of the product team) to create innovative features. UI Design Design processes, features, and components that can be used across products Create UI components for product flows. Contribute components to the Alto design system. Work collaboratively with Engineering to ensure finished product meets design specifications. Work in close collaboration with Design Leadership to grow the team as well as to inform and improve design processes What wed like to see on your resume: 6+ years professional experience, specifically as a Product Designer designing web-based products, with experience with UX and UI. Bachelors degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience. Experience leading and launching end-to-end product / product features Design Portfolio demonstrating strong UX and visual design solutions, with an emphasis on identifying and meaningfully solving true user problems. Exceptional track record executing on product design strategy, mentoring designers, and partnering with cross functional team members. Experience building world class product experiences, and streamlining workflows with continuous iteration and improvement. What you bring to the table: High proficiency in Figma Familiarity with other UX/UI software for creating flows, prototypes Ability to analyze and use data and research to inform decisions Utilize understanding and analysis of quantitative data, qualitative user understanding, and knowledge of business capabilities to develop features and product experiments Attention to detail Humble ‚Äî Not driven by personal opinions Excellent verbal and communication skills Excellent analytical skills to break down and solve complex problems Proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally Design discovery (user research, competitive research) Deep user empathy around complex/emotional categories Foundational understanding of HTML and CSS. Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills. Ability to lead user experience design, including usability principles, user research methodology, testing techniques (A/B, Multi-Variant), design theory, and interaction design. Willingness to roll up your sleeve and get things done. Take smart risks and champion new ideas. Passionate about contributing and maintaining design systems Skills such as illustration, animation, data visualization, front-end programming, or copywriting a plus

title: Web Designer
