title: Digital Specialist
description: The Air Line Pilots Association, International (ALPA), the largest airline pilot union in the world and the largest non-governmental aviation safety organization in the world (representing over 74,000 pilots at 42 U.S. and Canadian airlines) seeks an experienced Digital Specialist for our McLean, Virginia, office. The Digital Specialist provides digital creative and technical strategy to advance and support the Air Line Pilot Association‚Äôs online communications goals by maintaining and updating digital communications channels. As a self-starter, they will be responsible for maintaining websites for pilot groups including writing and creating content, posting on websites, styling websites, and working with the website team to keep websites current and updated. They also play a role in editing and creating email templates and sending email in ALPA‚Äôs email client, while supporting the mission, vision, and values of ALPA and striving to further the Association‚Äôs goals in the aviation industry. Daily, they will receive requests from pilot groups to upload files and content to websites as well as adjusting modules, layouts, and forms. Interested applicants will be requested to submit online portfolio link(s) showing previous work. Travel: 2 - 10%. ALPA is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in a safe workplace. We prohibit discrimination, harassment and harmful behavior of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or other protected characteristics as outlined in federal or provincial laws. We highly value everyone and all are encouraged to apply, including minorities, veterans, and people with disabilities.Qualifications: ¬∑ Bachelors degree in relevant area, e.g., Digital Media, Communications, Marketing, Public Relations, or related field preferred, from an accredited college or university; or, the equivalent combination of education and practical experience.¬∑ Minimum three (3) years of experience and demonstrated expertise in digital content strategy, email messaging, website development, and/or digital design, five (5) or more years strongly preferred.¬∑ Experience with email CRM platforms and Microsoft Office suite strongly preferred.¬∑ Ability to be a self-starter and manage daily workloads and project list independently with minimal supervision.¬∑ Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and familiarity with other markup and/or programming languages strongly preferred.¬∑ Experience designing for digital platforms within the Adobe Creative Cloud.¬∑ Ability to quality control text documents for distribution on web and email platforms.¬∑ Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, oral and written, for effective interaction with internal staff, external contacts, and pilots.¬∑ Ability to manage multiple projects at once, take direction from multiple sources, and meet deadlines.¬∑ Strong writing skills with command of grammar, syntax, and usage.¬∑ Strong proofreading skills.¬∑ Strong organizational skills.¬∑ Ability to understand and decipher information and documents of a technical nature.¬∑ Experience working with audio and video editing software a plus. Knowledge of labor-related issues preferred.¬∑ Ability to test and troubleshoot software.¬∑ Familiarity with new technologies and software for enhancing text, photographs, and graphics, strongly preferred.¬∑ Knowledge of labor-related issues strongly preferred.¬∑ Software: Proficiency in Content Management Systems. Proficiency with Adobe Suite for web publishing and graphic design including Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat, Adobe XD, and Dreamweaver. Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and SharePoint. Physical Demands: Note: The physical demands described herein are characteristic of those that must be met to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential physical activities of this position described below. Constantly operates a computer/smartphone/tablet. Regularly required to maintain a stationary position, move about the office and the local metropolitan area, determine what others have said or written, and converse with others and exchange accurate information. Regularly required to sit, stand, bend, reach, and move about the office and travel locally and nationally; international travel may be required infrequently. Also includes occasional bending, stooping, squatting, and/or pushing and pulling or moving, e.g., to pack, unpack, and/or move cases. Occasionally required to move, raise, reach, and/or retrieve binders, books, boxes, and files up to ten (10) pounds (lbs.). While on travel, may be responsible to move, raise, reach, and/or retrieve luggage weighing as much as fifty (50) lbs. (Assistance may not always be available.) Please apply online at https://jobs-alpa.icims.com/jobs/1461/digital-specialist/job ALPA offers competitive salaries with terrific benefits, including:¬∑ 401k Plan with Non-Elective Employer Contribution of 13% after 180 days of employment. No employee contribution required! The plan includes a Roth option and 4-year vesting schedule.¬∑ Generous health care benefits on day one ‚Äì PPO, Kaiser (where available), and a High Deductible Health Plan which includes coverage for medical, dental, and vision benefits for employee, spouse, and/or dependent children;¬∑ 27 days paid vacation and holidays per year plus 2 volunteer days per year;¬∑ Generous sick and bereavement leave;¬∑ Competitive parental leave;¬∑ Company-paid premiums for disability and life insurance;¬∑ Flexible Spending and Health Savings accounts;¬∑ Retiree health plan;¬∑ Education Assistance Program; and,¬∑ Optional benefits including pet insurance, excess life insurance, legal plan, and qualified transportation fringe benefits, where available. Relocation not provided.Sponsorship not available for this position.

title: Product Designer
description: Product DesignerAt Networx, we empower great people to do great work! Our core values are Chop Wood Carry Water, Do the Right Thing, Celebrate Success, and Evolve. These values guide our behaviors, and bold targets encourage us to bring our best selves to work daily. Our culture of fun, collaboration, and growth will help us all to share in the rewards of meeting our company mission; ‚ÄúWin Contractors More Jobs.‚ÄùWe are looking for a Product Designer to work on various products we develop for our customers. Product Designer responsibilities include defining product specifications, creating digital or print drawings and designing fully-functional products. To be successful in this role, you should have an eye for design and be able to translate requirements into practical product features. Ultimately, you will help us build products that are easy to use and visually appealing to our potential customers.What youll do Problem solve, think big, and explore divergent concepts/ideas while understanding how to converge and build iteratively toward your vision Partner with our Product team, take conceptual ideas and turn them into something useful and outstanding. Design flows and experiences that simplify and distill down complex actions into usable interfaces Design new experiences or layouts that evolve and define visual systems Contribute to strategic decisions around the future direction of Networx products Drive a partnership with product managers, engineers, researchers, and content strategists in order to oversee the user experience of a product from conception until launchWhat youll need 3-5 years of experience building b2c products (Web or Mobile) UI/UX Design Experience Deep understanding of interaction design with the knowledge to define how an experience should behave based on understanding peoples needs, plus consideration of how this product will scale. Use appropriate prototyping tools to demonstrate how a particular flow or interaction will work. Visual design experience with proficiency in typography, desktop/mobile UI, color, layout, iconography, and aesthetic sense and how these elements impact product function. Highly proficient with design tools (Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) Highly proficient with interactive prototyping tools (Framer, Principle, Origami, Invision Studio, etc.) What Youll Earn Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision) Retirement Plan (401k) Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D) Paid Time Off (Vacation, Bereavement & 9 Paid Holidays) Short-Term & Long-Term Disability Training & Development Work From Home Wellness Resources Competitive pay and bonus This position is hybrid with infrequent in office days for collaboration and open to candidates who live in the Atlanta or New York City Metropolitan areas.Why are we a great company to work for?Networx is a rapidly evolving, growth-oriented company with international operations.We invest in people. We consider each employee a long-term investment, and we see value in continuously nurturing and training our teammates. We offer and encourage ongoing knowledge-sharing, training, and career growth opportunities.Networx has a flexible approach to in-office work; for those living in the Atlanta, GA, or New York, NY Metropolitan areas. This position is considered Hybrid with infrequent required and nonrequired days in the office for collaboration. Networx proudly supports diversity in the workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.DISCLAIMER: The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

title: A Designer Thats Work Shows They Care
description: What We Are Looking For:We are looking for a designer, artist, and creative that DEEPLY CARES about creating magical products. We are looking for someone who wants to create a brand and experience that they view as a masterpiece they are proud of for decades to come.30,000 Foot View On Air:At Air, we are obsessed with creating magical products that will make our future grandkids proud and that cause our customer‚Äôs faces to light up. We are currently working on a suite of products that help businesses scale rapidly‚Ä¶ from a fintech platform that facilitates high ticket purchases, to a conversational AI that can have full-blown 25 minute sales calls and is indistinguishable from a human. Because of our customers love for our products, we‚Äôve generated $4.21MM in revenue since launching Air 29 days ago ($52MM/yr pace w/o a dime of VC capital).Comp:Salary: $120k-$250k a yearOwnership: 0-1% equityThe Most Important Question: Why Air?You are on a floating rock in the middle of the universe. Let that sink in.The truth is‚Ä¶ you do not need another ‚Äújob.‚Äù ‚Äî if that is what you are looking for, you can save your time and just stop reading now.What you need is to be a part of something that matters ‚Äî to be a part of something that causes you to tap dance into work everyday.At Air, we are obsessed with creating magical products that will make our future grandkids proud and that cause our customer‚Äôs faces to light up.After all, that is the real goal of building software‚Ä¶ not to generate ARR, not to prop up your valuation, not to raise more capital‚Ä¶ but to create products you are proud to stamp your name on and to create products that are a part of your life story.And the fascinating dichotomy that our team at Air believes in strongly is that a team obsessed with creating great products always has more success than a team focused primarily on making money.At Air, our focus on product is why we have generated $4.21MM in revenue since launching 29 days ago ($52MM/yr pace w/o a dime of VC capital).We aren‚Äôt building Air to sell in the next few years or to add some zero‚Äôs to our net worth. We want to build a company that lives long past any of our founders. A company that maintains an essence of excellence over the long term. A company that people can feel is synonymous with quality.We are looking for more A players to join our team that meet these 3 criteria:1. Someone Willing To Work Obsessively On Something They Truly Believe In (An Obsessive... They Think About ‚ÄúAir‚Äù All The Time)2. Someone With Years Of Evidence Of Exceptional Ability At Their Craft (And Learns Rapidly)3. Someone Who Is ‚ÄúOne Of Us‚Äù - The Thought Of Working With Them Everyday Excites Us (Businesses Are At Their Best When Everyone Enjoys Who They Are Going To War With Everyday)What would I be working on at Air?We have multiple areas a designer and creative could step in and have an immediate impact on our customer experience and brand as a whole: UI & UX: Helping create a unified experience across our suite of products. We want people to see our products and at a glance say Oh, that must have been built by Air Logos: We have multiple new products in development that will need on brand logos Website: Our current website is meh - We have a strong vision for how we could better convey what we are building and what we stand for Next steps?If you want to learn more about our vision and are curious about what we are building at Air and how you could contribute, apply belowCaleb Maddix, Co-Founder Of Air.ai

title: Brand Designer
description: About Us At Airhouse we help high-growth ecommerce companies simplify one of the most complex functions in their business: operations. Airhouse automates dozens of workflows and integrations to help companies get their products from factory to front door. From inventory and order management to warehouse partner sourcing and vetting, order fulfillment, returns and beyond, Airhouse makes it so that teams dont need to build a massive in-house operations team or any custom tech to manage fulfillment. Airhouse was founded in 2018, launched publicly in 2020, and currently serves 100+ high-growth businesses that manufacture everything from apparel to furniture to food and beverages.Airhouse‚Äôs core industry, logistics, is not historically design-forward. But, our customers are often themselves very creative brand-builders. At Airhouse, brand is a strategic imperative: we aim to make a memorable splash in the industry and in the minds of our customers. In this role as Brand Designer, you will grow Airhouse‚Äôs core style in new and experimental directions and own Airhouse‚Äôs overall look and feel.The right candidate for this role will be a creative but grounded designer who is skilled at balancing the competing demands of projects where design is involved, e.g. designing for conversion and designing within technical constraints.This is a full-time remote role that reports directly to our Co-Founder. Eligible candidates must be based in the United States. You will join as a senior individual contributor, with budget to extend your impact via outsourced agencies and consultants.Responsibilities Own our visual brand and its evolution in tandem with our Co-Founder and act as its guardian across the organization and the internet; ensure we create a single, cohesive experience of Airhouse, in particular for customers, but also for current and prospective employees, partners and others Develop visual concepts and materials for lead generation campaigns (ads, landing pages, social media graphics, etc.) with a cohesive look and feel, working with the team to quickly develop and test different iterations Wireframe and design responsive webpages in Webflow for our marketing website, airhouse.io, with a mobile-first approach (bonus if you can implement pages in Webflow) Design templates and graphics for sales proposals, marketing guides, ebooks, blog posts, documentation, presentations and other materials Create illustrations and diagrams for documentation to explain complex features, benefits and workflows for Sales, Marketing and Customer Success use Work closely with our Product Designer to ensure a single look and feel extends across all Airhouse properties and collaborate on maintaining a single, dynamic shared design system in Figma Manage design-related contractors and agencies alongside functional project leads, art direct and QA external design work to ensure it matches our brand and is functional, ensure production timelines are met, and secure resources where there are gaps Proactively help monitor written style when designing different materials and loop in relevant team members for content writing/voice and tone support Skills and Experience 3-5+ years working in brand, communications or visual design Some non-agency/in house experience preferred Strong art direction experience; you should feel comfortable taking our existing style guide, creating assets consistent with it, and then extending it, especially as it relates to graphics and illustration Strong grasp of grid systems, typography, and underlying design layout/composition principles Power user of Figma and Adobe CC: you not only know how to use these tools, but also believe in creating scalable design systems and asset libraries so that you can design efficiently and quickly onboard other designers onto projects Strong experience with design principles for web, including mobile-first responsive design Prior experience working with engineers to give feedback on implementation to match mockups, or strong HTML/CSS skills and the ability to work in Webflow Bonus if you have experience with any of the following: motion graphics, 2D illustration, 3D illustration, photography, video Benefits and Perks Competitive salary and equity based on experience A remote-first work environment with a headquarters in downtown San Francisco Comprehensive benefits package (medical, dental, vision, ancillary) Flexible time off policy that encourages you to take time off when you need it Optional all-team meetups A remote work stipend to create a productive work environment wherever you may be Paid parental leave and short-term and long-term disability insurance For consideration, please submit a portfolio demonstrating your ability to design across multiple standard business formats, with art direction examples.Equal Opportunity EmploymentAirhouse is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity of all kinds and believe it contributes to our success as we build a world-class company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, neurotype, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal or state law.

title: Product Designer
description: Your Mission, Should You Choose to Accept:Joining our small design team means you‚Äôll be working on a diverse range of projects with the opportunity to choose your own path, take ownership, and make a big impact. As we revolutionize the way people manage their expenses, being part of the Expensify team means designing the easiest, most efficient, and most beautiful platform to handle everything expense-related. Our employees work from all over the world, but if you‚Äôre looking for a change of scenery we offer visa sponsorship and relocation assistance to join us at one of our rad locations: San Francisco Portland Michigan New York London Melbourne And more to come! Even though we work hard at Expensify, we make sure our employees are happy. Our most talked about perk is our Offshore where we spend a month abroad working from a remote location as a team. Next year we‚Äôre going to South Korea, do you want to join?About YouWe‚Äôre looking for Product Designers who operate at the intersection of product functionality and brand feeling. You‚Äôre obsessive over the small details, but you enjoy solving big-picture problems to help push our strategic roadmap forward‚Äîall while maintaining the highest level of design delight in our product. You‚Äôre a systems-based thinker who likes developing clean and consistent UI patterns, and you‚Äôre also a generalist who loves working on the marketing design side of the role as well. As a Product Designer your responsibilities include: Working with our product and engineering teams to plan, design, and build new features and functionality Materially contributing to product roadmap decisions by balancing our company vision and business objectives against customer requirements Building, documenting, and maintaining our product design system in Figma, and working closely with our engineering team to make it come to life in our product Taking ownership over the product to push for the highest level of quality: no bug is too small to squash Designing and developing Expensifys visual brand Completing marketing design tasks like collateral, events, and promotions We‚Äôre looking for someone who: Has a high level of proficiency in Figma and the Adobe Creative Suite Has experience designing, building, and shipping end-to-end user flows Is comfortable working on front end issues and has a strong grasp of HTML and CSS basics Has a solid portfolio with an emphasis on product design Has a passion for detail, and an excellent use of type and layout in both digital and print Can effectively communicate ideas to teammates through mockups, prototypes, and concise written communication Is independently driven and comfortable working on projects autonomously Is capable of efficiently prioritizing multiple tasks across multiple teams Is a problem-solver and question-asker with a positive attitude Has a desire to learn and grow outside of their comfort zone Compensation & Benefits Full-time, salaried position 401k with 4.5% employer match 100% Medical/Dental/Mental Health support/Vision contributions Three months of fully paid parental leave, with up to six months for birthing parents Fully paid medical leave Commuter benefits (if applicable) $20 to spend on lunch daily Flexible vacation policy Relocation available Next StepsApplying is easy, but it takes time. See, while we know youre awesome, its actually really hard and time consuming to find you in the midst of literally hundreds of other applications we get from everyone else. So this is where were going to ask our first favor: can you make it really easy and obvious how great you are, so we dont accidentally overlook you? There are probably many ways to do that, but the easiest way to help us out is by answering the following questions: Please include a link to your portfolio (or include it here). If you don‚Äôt have one, why not? Whats your design history? When did you start, and what have you done between then and now? What do you want to do with the rest of your life, and how is Expensify a step toward your long-term goals? (We‚Äôre serious, we want to know! Share what you‚Äôre comfortable sharing, but we are a group of ambitious individuals building a community of people who want to achieve success in every aspect of our lives, and we encourage employees to figure out how they can use Expensify to realize their personal goals with the support of the company around them.) How did you hear about us? A job posting? Chalk on a sidewalk? From a friend? Let us know where you saw this opening. Resume not your thing? That‚Äôs great, we don‚Äôt really read them anyway! Forward your responses to the questions to apply@expensify.com. Were excited to hear from you!

title: Product Designer
description: Who We AreNess is an early-stage, remote-first startup at the unique intersection of fintech and healthcare. We‚Äôre on a mission to build a world where everyone can afford to get and stay healthy.We‚Äôre fresh off a $15.5M seed round and funded by some of the most iconic operators and entrepreneurs in the space (e.g. Sweetgreen, Headspace, One Medical, Thrive Market).Started by the former CEO & Founder of Greatist (acquired by Healthline in 2019), were building an AmEx-like credit card for health. We‚Äôve got enormous ambitions to flip healthcare on its head through an alternative to health insurance that rewards consumers for the right behaviors and brings down the cost of healthcare.What Impact You Can MakeAs a product designer on our Design team, you‚Äôll be crafting a revolutionary health and finance experience that has the potential to change healthcare forever.In this role, you‚Äôll drive discovery, research, ideation, and design of the product, as well as partner with engineering and product management to ship new experiences.This role sits within the Design team, under the Experience pillar.You May Be The Ideal Candidate If YouIf you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the below qualifications, you should still seriously consider applying. We take a holistic approach to evaluating talent for our team. Have 4-5 years of experience in product design, with work thats made its way into consumer-facing software (ideally, iOS). Have a design portfolio that showcases your eye for good visual design and attention to detail. Are a systems-thinker and can see beyond the pixels. Are highly collaborative in a remote-first environment and enjoy sharing work early and often. Are able to manage your work autonomously and comfortable with the pace that comes with an early-stage startup. Are a wizard in Figma (bonus points for motion design). Are a self-starter‚Äîthere‚Äôs always something you want to do, learn, and grow in as a designer. Have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product), Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience. Things You Might Do Design and shape the product experience into something truly magical. Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to identify new opportunities and envision creative solutions. Act as the champion for the user experience, clearly articulating design rationale internally and externally. Evolve our design process and standards such that it inspires and influences the work of others across the company. Support the team in constant experimentation through data and user feedback to improve the user experience and product. Empower engineers to get the fit and finish right. Our Core ValuesWe arent a family, were an incredible team. At Ness, our core values are the source of our POWER.‚úèÔ∏è Pencil It InWe move fast, try new things fearlessly, think differently, and learn from our mistakes.üôèüèº One NessWere all on the same team, have short memories, plus can disagree and commit.ü•ì Work CrispyWe value clear, rigorous thought, give regular feedback, and were always prepared.ü¶ï Embrace Your Mythical CreatureOur differences make us special. Come as you are (but no trolls, please!)üëèüèΩ Right Way To Win (Not The Easy Way)We believe in doing well AND doing good.How We HireFirst, we dont discriminate. We know from experience that a more diverse and inclusive team leads to bigger impact and success.1. First HelloYoull talk to our CXO & Co-Founder, Kenneth for 15-30 minutes. Theres nothing to prepare in advance.First, we want to figure out if youve got the right experience for this position and if working at Ness is a fit for you and us. Well have reviewed your portfolio in detail, so this discussion will be mostly a behavioral interview focused on what youve done before. We want to build conviction that youll succeed in this job the same way youve succeeded in the past.Then, youll have time to ask us anything! (Well, mostly anything.)2. The Jam SeshAfter this, well schedule a design jam with Kenneth and potentially other Ness team members. Why? We believe collaboration is a key skill for designers in a remote-first company‚Äîand we want a chance to see you in action. Well share more details about this when we get there!3. Portfolio ReviewNext, you‚Äôll have a chance to share 2-3 of your past projects and go deep on them. Here, we‚Äôre trying to understand your approach to design projects and see your craft in detail. We also want to learn how you frame the problem, how you articulate your process and decisions, and what explorations you considered prior to arriving at the final solution.4. Meet the TeamYoull meet other team members via a series of 30-60 minute 1:1‚Äôs including our CEO & Founder, Derek. Here, we want to explore if were a good fit for each other. We also want to learn what brings out the best in you and whats next. We want to be confident Ness can offer the environment (culture, responsibility, org structure, etc.) thats led you to the most professional success so far.Youll have time to ask questions, too!5. ReferencesOh‚Äîand, with your help, well reach out to folks youve worked with in the past. Were usually pretty far along here, so this is mostly about learning from outside perspectives about how to manage and empower you best.6. The Job OfferGot this far? That means youre in. Expect a personal call from Kenneth or Derek and welcome to the team!No recruiters or agencies, please. Thanks!

title: FT Contract Designer
description: Product Design & Innovation Lab dedicated to launching forward-thinking products and technologies to market.At Aither, were looking for a talented designer to join our team! The ideal candidate will have expert knowledge of current design software and be skilled in every step of the design process, from concept to final deliverable. We are currently in stealth, are very agile, and work primarily on AI and AR powered applications.Required skills and qualifications Exceptional creativity and innovative design skills Design Systems (Atomic Design) Excellent communication and presentation skills Organizational and time-management skills for meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment UI design experience UX Research Graphic Design Proficiency with Photoshop and Illustrator required Must include portfolio to apply. Remote-friendly and New York based. MUST be able to work EST or PST timezone if abroad.

title: Art Director / Creative Director
description: Say Hello to MilaClean air is one of the four basic necessities of life, yet most of us are airblivious. At Mila, our mission is to bring every family back from airblivion and shape the healthy home of the future.Mila Cares, Inc. is a San Francisco-based consumer electronics startup, with a fully distributed team around the world. Mila was started by three dads who wanted better for their own kids, turning a passion project into something that now powers more than 200 million hours of cleaner air (and counting) each year for families everywhere. We are backed by the late Paul Allen‚Äôs venture capital arm, Vulcan Capital, and two of the largest consumer brands in the world, including Electrolux. Our first product was a record-setting hit on Kickstarter, generating nearly $2M in pre-orders and winning TIME Magazine‚Äôs Best Inventions of 2021. Our second product won the CES 2022 Innovation Award in Home Electronics. We have a lot more in the pipeline and are looking for the next generation of talented, thoughtful leaders to help us bring these to market.At Mila we use the word ‚Äúthoughtful‚Äù in everything we do ‚Äì from our mission, to our product decisions, to our customer and team interactions. We know our customers buy our products for the health of their loved ones and we take that responsibility seriously.The RoleAs Milas founding art director, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to guide the visual narrative for a refreshingly thoughtful brand ‚Äì one whose brand mission is to cure the world of airblivion, helping every family breathe easier, and live healthier. We‚Äôll look to you to help evolve our brand story, and work closely with the team to develop and execute on a creative strategy that‚Äôs inspiring, measurable and scalable. .Key Responsibilities You‚Äôll help steer the creative ship by setting a consistent look and feel. Developing and executing on a creative strategy that can support the brand‚Äôs growth goals, with a keen understanding of how platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Google, video, TV, etc. work. Manage and prioritize multiple workstreams and ensure all deliverables consistently reflect our brand voice. In your first 60 days, you‚Äôll work on building key assets and setting up a process that allows for rapid creative iteration. Key Qualifications 5+ years of creative/brand work, having taken brands from inception to household names. You know what it takes to both tell and amplify a great story. Youre someone where design just courses through your veins :) You know what it takes to put together visuals that stand on their own and tell a story. You‚Äôre able to present a portfolio of work that highlights your understanding of innovative tech trends (and not being afraid to lean into it), an impeccable command of delivering strong creative, and an innate understanding of what makes something ‚Äústicky‚Äù Your written and verbal communication skills are second to none, and you can clearly paint both the larger creative vision as well as get into the nitty gritty of what‚Äôs needed to make it happen. Experience building and leading a creative team, and fostering a constructive feedback loop that pushes everyone to do their best creative work and let the best ideas rise to the top. A curious, growth driven mindset. You‚Äôre always looking for ways to improve and delight, and putting the customer at the core of your process. Empathy ‚Äî most importantly, you care, and love creating thoughtful, personal experiences at scale. To apply, please fill out this brief questionnaire -- youll also have an opportunity to include your portfolio: https://bit.ly/mila-art-director

title: Visual Designer
description: The RoleAs a visual designer at Alchemy, youll get to help define how the world views our brand and build. Youll work cross-functionally to build Alchemys global visual identity across our international user base with a focus on the future. Every piece of work you ship will be viewed by millions across major news outlets such as Bloomberg, New York Times, Wired, and the largest blockchain media outlets.Responsibilities Deliver delightful digital assets to all functions of the company, including leadership, marketing, communications, and engineering Lead the creative process from conception to creation across a wide breadth of use cases Help evolve the Alchemy brand Work on important investor presentations/decks, landing pages, and graphic compositions for blogs, newsletters, and more marketing efforts Iterate on design based on feedback from the greater team Maintain a high-quality threshold with regards to the Alchemy brand What Were Looking For 5+ years of experience as a visual designer, within a digital agency/studio or in-house, tech-related Inclusive of proven ability to design and deliver high-quality brand, marketing collateral Ability to ideate, conceptualize and sketch your design proposals Ability to take your concepts through to final production-ready Design-driven, but a strategy-led approach to executing visuals concepts Exceptional eye for design with a good pulse on current trends and best practices Thrive on multitasking on a wide range of subjects and projects You understand how to work to tight deadlines, over multiple projects, engage with multiple teams and deliver quality throughout everything you design. You take immense pride in your work and you strive to improve continuously over every project you work on. Proficient in Figma, Adobe CC suite (PS, AI & AE), Webflow (not essential but beneficial) You are passionate about shape, color, typography and have demonstrable knowledge of how to apply this. Passion for blockchain technologies is a plus Required: Work should be reflected in an amazing portfolio

title: UX Director (Freelance)
description: UX Director (Freelance)Work on groundbreaking products from the comfort of your home or during your travels abroad. Were looking for Freelance UX Directors to work with our New York and San Francisco Teams. Fantasy is building a freelance bench of the best design talent across the world to enable us to flex our design capability for clients when needed.Join our team A UX Director at Fantasy works to ship world-class products for pioneering companies. You will oversee talented teams and work hands-on with organizations to create future experiences that might range from global mobile OSs to web.Responsibilities Lead a team of talented designers Combine oversight with hands-on work Work end-to-end to ship great products Develop strong working relationships with clients Qualifications Proven experience in defining user experiences for a variety of applications, products, and platforms Strong communication skills, both written and oral, with the natural ability to articulate and defend design decisions Attention to detail Ability to excite and engage those around you to bring about the best outcomes Professional Experience 8+ years of experience in creative and digital agencies Experience leading the creation of digital products and platforms A portfolio showcasing innovative design solutions across a breadth of business verticals Checklist You have an online portfolio Youre ready to both lead and to learn You can work with our US Based Teams

title: Short Product Launch Video
description: Hi, I work in an insurance brokerage called Genesis Insurance Brokers based in Trinidad. On July 1st we will be celebrating our 5th anniversary and would like to launch a product called Genesis Elite. Its basically a membership card giving you access to discounts, treatments etc. We would like to develop a short product launch video (<2 minutes) We have the brochures and product details. Is this something you can complete before July 1st?

title: User Experience Designer
description: Anonyome Labs is creating a world in which people have exclusive control over their personal data.We‚Äôre changing the privacy and cybersafety paradigm‚Äîand resolving the greatest challenges consumers and enterprises face.Through our products, MySudo consumer app and Sudo Platform business privacy toolkit, we empower everyday users to decide when, where and with whom they share their personal information, and we help enterprises rapidly develop and deploy branded privacy and cybersafety solutions for their customers.In developing the Sudo digital identity at the heart of our products, we wanted to do something that hasn‚Äôt been done before ‚Äî because that‚Äôs what the global fight for data privacy will demand from us all: out of the box thinking and .If you want to join us at the leading edge of data privacy, apply to join our team now. There‚Äôs never been a better time.Anonyome Labs is looking for a Product (UX) Designer to partner closely with product managers, designers, marketers and engineers to build and ship creative solutions and experiences for our consumer, mobile and desktop applications. You‚Äôll design workflows, interactions, prototypes, and visuals that are thoughtful and practical, impacting Anonyome, our customers, and their customers.Requirements: 4+ plus years of product based UX design experience working on complex iOS, Android, desktop and web apps. Has a portfolio of work demonstrating skills in visual design, UI design, interaction design, prototyping/testing, user research and information architecture. In-depth experience with Sketch and the Adobe Creative Suite. A strong understanding of Apple‚Äôs Human Interface Guidelines and Material Design. Own the design process for your team‚Äôs features, including research, validation, and iteration. Partner with product managers and engineers to oversee the user experience of a product from concept to launch. Ability to communicate and present your work (from sketches to final products) and articulate your design decisions to stakeholders for review and feedback. Effectively manage projects to meet deadlines, roadmaps, and requirements; be able to keep projects on track and progressing despite setbacks and unforeseen issues. The prioritization skills that let you work on many projects at once while maintaining commitments. Added Bonus Graphic design, traditional print, illustration and or photography understanding a plus. HTML & CSS skills are a plus Finally, we expect you to score extremely high on our Stuff That Matters:Enhancing Privacy Privacy is at Our CoreGrowing as One team Work Inclusively, Embrace Diversity, Succeed TogetherSharing Insights Information empowers our decision makingTaking Ownership Own it, enjoy it, learn from itFeeding Curiosity Always learning**Hybrid work options available for remote and in-office located in Lehi, UT**We offer health, dental, vision & life insurance plans, unlimited PTO, remote work, equity, catered lunches, and an exciting and innovative atmosphere. If you‚Äôre interested in changing the world, we‚Äôd love to talk to you.

title: Creative UX Designer and CRO-Specialist
description: This is not a normal job.Were looking for a designer constrained by logic/reason in their design; focused on the minimal viable solution to create the desired impact; and which has a fundamental understanding of conversion-optimization techniques. It could be as few as 3 hrs/wk, but the sky is the limit as ROI drives us. But thats not important yet.How about we start here: Normal Job: Your boss tells you what to do. Your boss tells you how to do it. Nadine West: You decide what to do based on our goals. We figure out how to do it. You change the company.What Is The Role?We prefer not to box you into a specific label. We dont want to confuse skills with jobs.How do you do your job?1. Identify Problems (whats holding us back from hitting our goals) 2. Solve Problems (as fast as you can)What You Bring To The TableYou love the art and science of design (typography, tools, flow, aesthetics). You love the thrill of increasing conversion-rate. Its like a game. We trust your logical decision-making. Youll have the freedom to gather insights, talk to users, look at data. Your ideas are only as good as the effects they produce on the user-behavior. We dont design for the sake of design. We design for the user. LEADER We want you to lead. You dont follow direction, you create direction. Push our pace. You accept nothing less than the A-game of those around you. Call B.S. when you see it. Sloppy execution = B.S. Opinions w/o Evidence = B.S. Lets call each other out. SCALE Were a lean team. Every person wears many hats. Youll need to as well.This Is Interesting. Now What?Talk is cheap. Interviews are incredibly difficult to discern good fits. Historic work is good, but not perfect. We try to run a very short, paid test to cover the gap (3-5 hrs of work). If you test, interpret the instructions as you see fit. Better yet, let us know why the test is dumb and what the actual test should be. We want you to demonstrate your best self: How you identify and solve problems How fantastic your intuition is (even with your minimal exposure to us) The dynamic range of your skills (why youre not just an artistic designer)

title: Senior UI-UX Designer
description: Hey!We are RƒÄNADEV, a design and development agency based out of Seattle, WA. From concept to buildout, we make game-changing applications with industry leading UX and hella-good code.We‚Äôre looking for REALLY COOL product designers to work on cutting edge projects in the AI, Web3, Fintech and Blockchain space.THE SPECIFICS UI designer who is proficient in SKETCH and or FIGMA Excellent product design and design fundamentals, including visual design, typography, UI design, interaction design, and information architecture Able to provide both Desktop AND mobile of each design Also VERY good at UX and creating user experience that is new and pushes the limits of what exists Is able to create high-fidelity motion prototypes of designs, both in small animations and entire application using After Effects Needs to design the UI as part of the UX together, and not start with wireframes Last, need to be communicative and available for conversation. Communication is EXTREMELY important POSITIONYoull be Senior Product Designer (Full-time Independent Contractor) working directly for RƒÄNADEV in a remote position. Well be offering you an awesome and competitive payout that is well above the industry standards for this role.HOW TO APPLYKindly send your responses to the following questions to kartik@ranadev.io ALONG WITH the link to your portfolio. On a scale of 1-10 (10 being the highest), how familiar and proficient are you with designing in Sketch? On a scale of 1-10 (10 being the highest), how familiar and proficient are you with designing in Figma? On a scale of 1-10 (10 being the highest), how familiar and proficient are you in turning your designs into motion prototypes? On a scale of 1-10 (10 being the highest), how familiar and proficient are you in turning your designs into motion prototypes using Adobe After Effects? On a scale of 1-10 (10 being the highest), how familiar and proficient are you in using a 3D package like Blender/Cinema 4D? If you had specifications, how many hours would it take you to create a dashboard from scratch in Sketch or Figma? Do you have experience handing your designs off to front end developers and making sure that they are executed properly? Are you OK with a bi-monthly payout for a full-time position? What is your hourly rate? THE PROCESSStep 1: You apply for the position and send the answers to the questions above to kartik@ranadev.io along with the link to you portfolio.Step 2: Well screen the candidates for an interview based on the responses to the questions above and the portfolio.Step 3: Youll be sent a Zoom invite for a video interview where well get to know each other even better!Step 4: Well contact you back within 24 hours with your offer.Step 5: Onboarding! ü•≥

title: Senior Product Designer
description: DescriptionAbout MurmurationMurmuration is a nonprofit organization focused on leveraging civic engagement to drive greater equity. We are committed to transforming public education so that every child ‚Äì regardless of who they are or where they live ‚Äì can benefit from the same opportunities afforded by a quality education.We provide sophisticated tools, data, strategic guidance, and programmatic support to help our partner organizations increase civic engagement and marshal support to drive change at the community level. Our best-in-class data and easy-to-use tools have been used by hundreds of organizations to make informed decisions about who they need to reach and how to achieve and sustain impact ‚Äì and to put those decisions into action.Our team includes experts and innovators in data, analytics, and strategy. We are former teachers, organizers, data scientists, and campaign veterans, and we are looking for people whose passion and expertise can help realize our vision.Note: At Murmuration, we are committed to becoming an even more diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. To this end, all staff members are expected to actively participate in DEI (diversity, equity, inclusion) programming.About the RoleThis is a full-time position reporting to our Manager of UX Design and joining a close-knit group of Product Designers.As a Senior Product Designer, you will play a pivotal role in determining the look, feel, and user experience for one of our products within a growing product portfolio including enterprise software tools and mobile apps. You‚Äôll dive into the weeds wherever needed within your product Pod to help keep the team moving. Based on the business and product context, constraints, and requirements, you‚Äôll focus on designing what drives the most impact: innovating where it drives a key outcome and building from prior learnings to avoid reinventing the wheel.What You‚Äôll Do: Effectively and empathically collaborate with cross-functional teams of researchers, product managers, engineers, marketers, and data scientists; Advocate for and employ user-centered design methodologies to thoroughly understand customer goals and pain points, and help others do the same; Design early-stage product ideas, learn from experiments, iterate quickly to propose new hypotheses, and deliver actionable insights to your team; Deliver end-to-end feature design work, including user journeys and flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes; Regularly present designs to stakeholders for feedback and to the company at large Mentor and collaborate with other designers to apply best practices, learn cutting edge techniques, and coordinate on a rich product ecosystem; and Help drive continuous improvement of our design practice from tools to process to team culture RequirementsWhat You Should Have Passion for civic engagement, campaigns, and equitability; Excellent product design fundamentals, including visual design, UI design, interaction design, and information architecture; Demonstrable real-world design expertise in complex SaaS products on teams using Agile software development methodologies; Skill in strategizing at a high level then breaking down and targeting the tactical pieces to realize the vision in a phased approach; Expertise in creating and using design systems to drive consistency and reusability throughout a suite of products; Deep understanding of accessibility and responsive/adaptive design to accommodate different form factors; A bias for action and the ability to thrive working in fast-paced climates (e.g., start-up or similar); A strong commitment to data-driven decision making: welcoming both qualitative and quantitative data on the impact of our products to enrich the iterative design process; Mastery of industry-standard design and collaboration tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Jira, and Miro (or equivalent); and A portfolio that showcases how you designed real world solutions and the role you played in bringing them to life (online is preferred). What you could have: Experience with CRMs, political or advocacy campaigns, and/or civic organizing products; Experience with analytics tools such as Pendo, Mixpanel, Fullstory, Google Analytics, or similar; Design expertise in data visualization; Visual identity branding experience; and/or Training in behavioral science (RCTs, interventions, etc.) Talented Senior Product Designers come from all walks of life and career. If you are passionate about civic engagement and technology, please apply, even if you do not check every box!BenefitsLocation, Compensation, and BenefitsThe Senior Product Designer is a full-time, salaried position with a comprehensive benefits package. It is based anywhere in the U.S. The salary range for this position is $115,000 - $135,000 and is commensurate with experience.An Equal-Opportunity Employer with a Commitment to DiversityMurmuration is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and as an organization committed to diversity and the perspective of all voices, we consider applicants equally of race, gender, color, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, disability, political affiliation, and national origin. We reasonably accommodate staff members and/or applicants with disabilities, provided they are otherwise able to perform the essential functions of the job.

title: Product Designer
description: This is a remote role open in EMEAWho we areWe are Kisi, a physical security technology company that accelerates a world where the right people can share physical resources at any time. Founded in 2012, Kisi operates from a headquarter in Brooklyn (USA), an office in Stockholm (Sweden), and a remote team across the globe.What we doWe bring simple and secure physical security to people and organizations anywhere. Our award-winning hardware and compliance-certified software form the core of our physical security platform that helps businesses around the world connect and control their spaces through the cloud. With our seamless access experience and real-time data and analytics we help make spaces available to the right people at any time. But don‚Äôt just take our word for it: explore our award-winning Reader Pro, which recently won the coveted GOOD DESIGN award as well as the prestigious iF Design Award. Curious about how Kisi works? Check out this short product demo.How and why we do itAt Kisi, you will have the freedom to do your work in the way you work best. There‚Äôs a flat hierarchy (work alongside our co-founders Carl, Max, and Bernie!), a strong sense of ownership, and the freedom to get creative. We also try to limit meetings as much as possible, so you can have dedicated focus time. Our mission is clear: ensure ease of facility access and remote space management, providing access systems to create a secure future where spaces are connected and accessible without boundaries.Your roleWe are looking for a talented individual to join our team and shape the user experience for our mobile and web apps, used globally by hundreds of thousands of admins and end users. Your creativity and analytical skills will be utilized to deliver best-in-class experiences (UX and UI) that are seamless, intuitive, efficient, and exciting. Your responsibilitiesResponsibilities include owning the user experience for our mobile and web applications, conducting competitive and user research, gathering feedback, and working closely with our product managers, UI designer, and developers to implement your ideas. You are expected to contribute to design work (UI) as well, so a few years of experience with working with tools like Figma to build user interfaces and other visual deliverables is required.We strive to move fast and want everyone to make an impact as early as possible. In your first 30 days, you will develop a deep understanding of your context, and in your first 90 days, you will work with the product management team to identify three areas for improvement and present tangible results. Your qualifications You share our values: forward, human, trusted, and responsible. You have worked, in-depth, with user experience and relevant research before, as part of an agency or a product company. You are highly proficient with graphical design tools like Figma to craft interfaces and other visual deliverables. You have a passion for technology. Our products are technical in nature. What you can expect Impact. It‚Äôs all about making a positive impact on people‚Äôs everyday lives. At Kisi, you are expected to make meaningful contributions to shape the future of physical security. Excellence. We strive for excellence and best-in-class experiences in everything we do. We are innovative and obsessed with the details that matter. Culture. Our culture is not a written manifest, but the result of all of us. We place great emphasis on building a company that is open, welcoming, challenging and fun. Ownership. We don‚Äôt believe in micro-management, but we do believe in setting and getting goals. At Kisi, you will own goals, and have freedom under responsibility. Diversity. We are American, Argentinian, Brazilian, Danish, English, Ethiopian, German, Indian, Nigerian, Swedish, and more. Learn more about who we are and our Values.Your benefits Team offsites. The Kisi Krew meets up from time to time in person in new exciting locations. Equipment. You will be set up with all the necessary equipment to do your job to the best of your ability. Vacation days. Sweden: minimum 25 days PTO. USA and Remote: minimum 20 days PTO. Healthcare and pension. USA: health coverage, 401k. Sweden: health coverage, life insurance, pension plan. Remote: build your own package. Grow with us. We are here to support you in your growth whether you want to become a manager, learn a new skill, or move into a new role.Referral program. You will get $2.500 for each successful hire we make from your referrals.What‚Äôs not to like? Send in your application, free up your calendar, and lets talk!Your process with usApplication > CV screening > Intro call (let‚Äôs get to know each other!) > Recruitment task > Technical Interview > Culture Interview > Offer > Background check

title: Product Designer
description: ABOUT FLOWNFLOWN is a mission-driven startup dedicated to enhancing focus, creativity, and fulfilment in work life.With so many online and offline distractions, we are eroding our ability to focus at work, and the move to remote work driven by COVID has meant people have lost the workplace rituals and human connection that provided accountability, novelty, and meaning.Using the science behind deep work and flow states, FLOWN has created a platform offering live focus sessions, led by charismatic facilitators, to deliver focus, accountability and community to distracted professionals everywhere.FLOWN is led by serial entrepreneur Alicia Navarro, who founded content monetization platform Skimlinks (acquired by Connexity April 2021) and was Chair of proptech platform Yourkeys (acquired by Zoopla June 2021).ABOUT THE ROLEOne of FLOWNs core values is a deep appreciation for good design and seamless flow, and its importance in imbuing moments with delight, beauty, ease, and clarity.As our Product Designer, you won‚Äôt just shape our platforms aesthetic; you‚Äôll directly influence our user‚Äôs ability to work effectively and enjoyably, and develop healthy habits that make their lives better. Your design will be at the heart of our mission, making the FLOWN brand synonymous with ease, beauty, and productivity.We are particularly interested in a designer who has a keen interest or experience in behavioural science and habit formation. You will have the chance to apply these principles to create user interfaces that not only look great but also promote positive work habits and enhance user productivity.RESPONSIBILITIESHeres some of things youll be responsible for: Lead the design function, shaping the visual and interactive identity of FLOWN. Collaborate closely with our Product Director and Founder to conceptualise, design, and refine the features of the FLOWN platform. Your input will be essential to our products direction and evolution. Work with our Product Director to conduct discovery and user research, map out our use cases, user personas, and various customer journeys. Actively engage with our Tech team to ensure they have all the designs, specifications and assets needed and participate in acceptance testing to ensure high visual and UX standards. Design the user interface and user experience of all features and interactions on our website and platform. Create and rapidly iterate prototypes at various levels of fidelity, turning ideas and concepts from sketches and wireframes into development-ready specifications. Manage and enrich our platform design system and asset library. Ensure the FLOWN brand design is consistently represented across all the work we produce, from decks to documents to interface design to customer collateral. Stay abreast of competitors, other great visual brands, new trends, and best practices in order to bring this perspective into your rationale for features, design concepts and UX decisions. REQUIREMENTSWe think you‚Äôll need the following experience in order to succeed in the role: 3+ years of experience as a UI/UX designer. Experience with both visual/graphic design experience alongside wireframing & user flows. Highly proficient in Figma Exposure designing for B2C community products advantageous. Experience working within an early-stage business is preferable. In addition, here are the core attributes we think youll need to succeed in the role: Creative, passionate, a strong aesthetic, and sound judgement - you create unique, beautiful, clean and engaging designs. You are excited by our mission and use this passion to create user experiences that will drive value. You are the champion of what good looks like, and you use this skill to make wise empathetic decisions, and to guide others in the same way. Collaborative - you understand that product design touches upon all teams, as well as our members and hosts. You proactively and constructively share your opinions, plans and insights with team members, and you regularly solicit the views and needs of others - be they internal team members or users of FLOWN. Product mindset - you understand how to observe and extract information about what customers want from a product. You use these insights to evolve our product and its UI in a way that keeps them happy, engaged, and retained. Organised and resilient - you thrive in a fast-paced team, prioritise a busy workload, juggle multiple tasks, and work to quick-turnaround deadlines. You are unfazed when theres a lot on your plate or curveballs are thrown your way. BENEFITSWe want to practice what we preach, and build a company and team that works creatively and productively. Here are some of the benefits youll gain from this role: Scope and influence - youre joining the founding team and will be involved in shaping our product, what we do, and how we work. A focus on deep work - we exist to support deep work among our members, so we support our staff in developing their own distraction-free deep work practice. A strong team - we are led by a proven CEO & Founder, and the rest of the team is equally highly experienced. We also have a high-calibre of investors with a good amount of member traction already. Fully dispersed, flexible working - we are a remote-first company, and weve got lots of perks, tools and processes to make sure that works for everyone. We encourage individuals to establish working hours that enable them to work as productively as possible, and we understand that everyone needs a work/life balance. Team socials - we get together regularly to collaborate and have fun. We also embed virtual activities and other surprises into our working days. Stock options - you‚Äôll own a part of the company, so its success will be your own too.

title: Product Designer - UI/UX
description: CryptoHub offers a variety of high-quality, one-of-a-kind crypto trading tools and innovations to improve the average crypto traders experience and safety when trading crypto.At CryptoHub, traders can utilize a range of resources, including a tool that performs sophisticated data analysis of every token on the blockchain, a smart contract builder, and launchpads.We are seeking an experienced UI/UX Designer to join our team.Working hours - preferably GMT+2 time zone, 9 hours a day (or more if want).What we seek:1. 3+ years experience specifically in web/apps design.2. Extensive experience with Figma which includes:‚Ä¢ knows how to work with Atomic design‚Ä¢ Knows HIG and Google Material Design‚Ä¢ knows how to manage Design Systems‚Ä¢ experience in working with CSS libraries like: Bootstrap, Base, Carbon, HIG, Google Material Design)‚Ä¢ knowing Figma: autolayout, components, shared libraries, components properties.‚Ä¢ basic knowledge of HTML, CSS (optional).3. English level - good / can talk and understand decently.Must add a link to portfolio.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: We are looking for a part-time product designer with experience building mobile products. We are looking to bring cutting edge generative AI to the business users.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: About the opportunityWe‚Äôre looking for a seasoned, versatile product designer to join our team as we build a world-class platform to power live event experiences around the world.This role works continuously alongside cross-functional teams of PMs and developers to shape products that are simple, polished, and thoughtful. We love folks that bring an intrapreneurial energy and thrive in an iterative and fluid product development environment. If that sounds like you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.The core of what you‚Äôll be doing Own and craft the end-to-end user journey and product design execution ‚Äì from concepts and prototyping to testing and delivery. Consistently uphold the quality and craft of design through all points of the user experience. Partner with Product and Engineering leads and other supporting teams to shape and execute design strategy. Articulate the narrative of your design solutions to stakeholders, partners and peers. What we‚Äôll look for in you You‚Äôre a great listener and communicator. Your work is precise, thoughtful, refined and polished. You have at least 8+ years leading product and UI design in a professional role. Your strong portfolio shows you‚Äôve had a central design role in shipping products to real customers. You‚Äôve got an ability to articulate your design decisions to others with clarity and thoughtful reasoning. You have a natural inclination to seek feedback, ask smart questions and absorb different perspectives from Research, Product and Engineering to develop a well-reasoned design approach. You‚Äôre fluent in Figma and component-based design methods. You‚Äôve got strong prototyping skills. You show as well as tell. You are versatile across platforms and form factors ‚Äì from native mobile apps to web, small screens to large. We‚Äôd love you to have‚Ä¶ A habit of continuous learning. An action-oriented, builder mindset. Constructive feedback skills that make everyone around you better. An all-around positive attitude! Benefits Work where you live. This is a remote position. Join our team from where you are. Generous paid time off. It‚Äôs important to take care of yourself (and those that depend on you). Family Leave policy. Healthcare coverage. We offer competitive health, dental and vision coverage, and a range of other benefits. Find community. Our Employee Resource Groups help foster a culture of diversity, support and inclusivity. About the division & teamOur Digital Growth group lives at the intersection of technology, content, and events, operating scaled businesses and creating new direct-to-consumer offerings with the world‚Äôs best creative talent and brands at the center. We are a team of product managers, designers, engineers and data scientists focused on building cutting-edge products that help shape an engaging future for events.More about EndeavorEndeavor is a global media and entertainment company with world-class brands and capabilities across talent representation, sports, fashion, event management, and brand marketing. Comprised of industry leaders including entertainment agency WME; sports, fashion, events, and media company IMG; and premier mixed martial arts organization UFC, Endeavor likely plays a significant role in the content you love and the experiences and events that you never forget. Our companies and represented talent and brand clients collectively reach billions of passionate fans, directly, every single day.Endeavor is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

title: Product Designer
description: The Product Designer will be part of the Experience Design team which works on Product Design at Plutus ‚Äî between Web app, Android and iOS App. And since Plutus‚Äôs main audience is our community and app users, we agonize over and take pride in crafting user-friendly and user-focused experiences.If you feel this could be of interest, come in for a chat! We like bright minds.Responsibilities Work closely with engineers and product managers to work on core banking and payment features for Plutus‚Äôs iOS and Android app taking it to next level Advocate for best user experience on core perks and subscription tiers. Able to go deep on details and also comfortable zooming out and seeing big picture and connecting the dots Initiate and run user research team, drive and support UX research projects using tools such as Maze or Usertesting.com Participate in design reviews and share your work regularly with the design and company leadership Understand the array of technical constraints, user goals, and business requirements that shape a product- understand principles and tradeoffs. Structure and facilitate ideation workshops for an emerging product category Requirements 3-5 years of lived product designer experience - fintech experience preferred Interested in crypto / digital assets a must Familiar with native mobile design patterns on Android and iOS and gave designed polished apps for both platforms Have an exceptional portfolio demonstrating strong product and visual design sensibilities and experience in creating concepts, customer journeys, specifying interaction details, and prototyping internally and with users Knowledge of asset implementation standards on iOS, Android, and Web (we use Figma) Committed to user-first mindset and interested in crafting excellent user experiences Preference for experience design Exhibits our core values: do the right thing, consistently ship and know what good looks like

title: Mid/Senior Developer (Full/Part-time, UK Remote)
description: Job Title Mid/Senior Developer (Full/Part-time, UK Remote) Job Description We are looking for a mid/senior ‚Äúfull stack‚Äù Python developer to work alongside our Head of Software. Together you will develop and support our customer facing portal, data workbench, business intelligence platform and our internal lab management systems. You will need to be a specialist in building secure, well-tested web applications using Django though there is scope for the successful candidate to influence all parts of our stack. This is a small, successful, organically grown company and there will be a wide variety of things to work on (we use robots!), and necessarily some shifting priorities. Benefits Fair pay (¬£45,000 - ¬£80,000 FTE based on experience) Full Time OR Part Time (3+ days a week considered) 38 days holiday (inclusive of bank holidays) Generous employer pension contribution into NEST scheme The tools you need - all equipment is provided along with a one off employee workstation benefit to help get you set up Flexible working hours to meet commitments you have outside of work An opportunity to work in an industry supporting life- and world-changing science Main Duties and Responsibilities To contribute to the design and implementation of MicrobesNG‚Äôs applications and infrastructure. To be involved in technology selection on new projects, and to suggest operational changes where you can see benefit. To follow quality control and compliance procedures, helping to close gaps and seek continuous improvement. To keep your peers and line manager apprised of progress and to actively communicate blockers and seek their resolution. To be interested in general business operations and to assist other departments as and when required. To be reasonably available during core UK business hours for occasional meetings and other discussions. We do ask the team to attend monthly 1-day onsite visits in Birmingham, but candidates for whom this is not practical will be considered. Restrictions Telecommuting is OK No Agencies Please Requirements Strong Python, Django, SQL, JavaScript, HTML, CSS Pragmatic approach to achieving good test coverage Experience implementing public-facing web applications Experience designing and implementing common web architectures, and configuring their components (e.g. NGinx, MySQL, Redis) Comfort with cloud deployments ‚Äì e.g. AWS ‚Äì an advantage Experience solving challenges with observability and diagnostics A respectful and pragmatic approach to providing technical guidance to colleagues A grounding in Linux sysadmin and network concepts Good English proficiency Experience using, maintaining and designing CI Experience with database schema design and optimisation Knowledge of security- and privacy-by-design principles Existing eligibility for the right to work in the UK at point of application About the Company MicrobesNG is a genome sequencing facility dedicated to providing microbial sequence data to our expanding global customer base. We currently sequence over 40,000 genomes each year from a wide variety of medical, agricultural and environmental microbes including bacteria, fungi, viruses and plasmids. After our extraordinary success working within the University of Birmingham for 5 years we spun out and set up as an independent company in August 2019. Having increased our business since then, we are looking to expand the company and our services. Contact Info Contact: Mark Kennedy E-mail contact: jobs@microbesng.com Web: https://apply.workable.com/microbesng/j/540D1E4880/

title: Deputy CPython Developer in Residence
description: Job Title Deputy CPython Developer in Residence Job Description The Python Software Foundation (PSF) is hiring for a full-time Deputy Developer in Residence, reporting to the CPython Developer in Residence. Role description In support of The PSF‚Äôs mission , we are hiring to facilitate a role within the Python community that will focus on assisting CPython maintainers and the Steering Council. Areas of responsibility will include issue triaging, code review, preparing PR backports, improving the automation around the Python language, and communicating with the core team to ensure their work isn‚Äôt blocked. As the Deputy Developer in Residence, you will work full-time on CPython, including a variety of projects covering the day-to-day collaborator workflow on GitHub and continuous integration, applying your technical expertise to design, develop, test, and propose changes with a workflow-minded focus. As an externally funded role, the term for this position will initially be one year with the possibility of extension based on available funding or renewals of funding. Responsibilities Keeping the core development workflow operational to ensure core developers and collaborators are not blocked from contribution. Improving tools and workflows, which are part of the core development experience, to enable a smoother contribution process. Code review of a subset of incoming changes to CPython to help collaborators receive timely communications on their changes. Authoring own changes to CPython to help clean the issue and PR backlog. Responding to requests for assistance from core developers in a timely manner. Restrictions No telecommuting Agencies are OK Requirements Minimum Qualifications Experience with software development using the Python programming language. Experience with open source software development and open source tools and best practices, as a contributor and/or as a maintainer. Experience working with a mix of stakeholders, i.e., volunteers, staff, and sponsors. Ability to work independently in a fully remote environment. Excellent written and verbal communication. Preferred Qualifications Experience in building and deploying networked applications. Experience with software development using the C programming language. Experience with CPython internals. Details Applicants from around the world are welcome for this remote position. If the applicant is based outside the USA, the PSF would offer an independent contractor role, structured with autonomy to meet agreed goals of the position in the manner you determine; income may be subject to US income tax. If the applicant is within the USA, the PSF would offer a full-time employee role with compensation including salary, 401K, as well as health (full premium paid by the PSF), dental, and vision insurance and paid time off. Total compensation will range between $100,000-$120,000 USD based on qualifications and experience. This position will report to the CPython Developer in Residence and collaborate with the Steering Council. Some recurring availability within the US Eastern time zone will be necessary for check-ins and reporting. The ability and willingness to travel annually to PyCon US is a plus for this position. About the Company Apply The call for resumes will be open until July 26th 2023. Please use this link to apply with your resume and cover letter. The Python Software Foundation is a US 501(c)(3) non-profit corporation that holds the intellectual property rights behind the Python programming language. We also run the PyCon US conference annually, support other Python conferences/workshops around the world, and fund Python-related development with our grants program. To see more info about the PSF, check out our Annual Impact Report and public records. We believe that the future of open source must include everyone. We welcome all job-seekers regardless of race, color, ethnicity, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, physical appearance, body size, socio-economic, veteran or disability status. Python is a global community and the PSF aims to support a safe environment for all. More information can be found on our Code of Conduct page. Contact Info Contact: Deb Nicholson E-mail contact: donnotemail@python.org Web: https://pythonsoftwarefoundation.applytojob.com/apply/9jXnEu0MuJ/Deputy-CPython-Developer-In-Residence

title: Educational consultant (Advanced Computer Science course & PCAP/PCAD)
description: Job Title Educational consultant (Advanced Computer Science course & PCAP/PCAD) Job Description Job details: Project based / Part time (~40 hours in total / 8 weeks) Responsibilities: Create a course idea and concept & detailed syllabus & python project descriptions for ‚ÄúComputer Science 3 with Python‚Äù course Align course syllabus with TEKS CS3 standards and PCAP & PCAD objectives Provide expertise in computer science & programming field and consult course methodologists on course content Propose points of course improvements based on feedback from partners, students, teachers, team Restrictions Telecommuting is OK Agencies are OK Requirements Advanced English Excellent grasp of computer science / software engineering skills Degree and / or professional experience in computer science / software engineering Experience in online courses creation would be an advantage Pedagogical thinking: appropriate learning activities design and creative approach to lesson development Attention to detail, adaptability, and receptiveness to feedback and direction About the Company YaizY is an online education service with a wide range of high-quality courses in areas defining the future, such as entrepreneurship, innovation, computing, design and multimedia arts. On our platform 8-17 year old kids take live online classes in small groups led by our tutors, all rigorously selected and trained in a proprietary training system. We envision YaizY as a place where every child can find a path to a happy life and meaningful work. YaizY will help kids build their personalized diplomas and utilize a system of partnerships, employers and schools to lead them to internships and employment. YaizY was founded in 2019 by a global team of entrepreneurs, industry experts, and professionally trained, award-winning educators with decades of international experience - all on a mission to become the most trusted online learning platform, inspiring students to turn their passions into professions. Contact Info Contact: Evgeniy Pokrovskiy E-mail contact: evgeniy.pokrovskiy@yaizy.io Web: https://www.notion.so/yaizy/YaizY-Computing-Academic-Authority-ab78b5b392ac4bb695d8225cba835e00?pvs=4
